title: Systemutvecklare till ny enhet i Trelleborg
description:
Placeringsort
Trelleborg
Diarienummer
FK 2025/024847  



*Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan 21 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 260 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför tänker vi nytt och använder den senaste tekniken för att förenkla och förbättra, utveckla och leverera it-tjänsterna för den svenska socialförsäkringen. Välkommen till en av Sveriges största IT-avdelningar.*Trelleborg är ett nyetablerat it-kontor och vi söker nu förstärkning för att för att utöka verksamheten med en ny enhet. Du som medarbetare är vår viktigaste tillgång. Vi uppmuntrar aktivt att alla tar ansvar för och använder tid till sin kompetensutveckling. Vi erbjuder en modern arbetsplats med stora möjligheter att utvecklas på både djup och bredd där vi lägger stort fokus på kompetensutveckling samt fysiskt och psykiskt välmående.


**Kodutveckling, agila team, design och analys**
------------------------------------------------



Vi fortsätter att växa och nu söker vi dig som är systemutvecklare med stort intresse för kodutveckling. Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och bidra i arbetet med att bygga samhällsviktiga funktioner och samtidigt jobba med modern teknik på en spännande arbetsplats.



Som systemutvecklare hos oss är du i huvudsak kodutvecklare och driver frågor kring realisering av arkitekturprinciper, design och kodkvalitet. Du kommer jobba i agila team med stort fokus på eget ansvar och vilja att ständigt förbättra vår verksamhet, där ditt engagemang och dina idéer är viktiga. En god användarupplevelse är en viktig del av arbetet. Du förväntas samarbeta väl med andra, värna om kvalitet och ha en vilja att utvecklas tillsammans med oss.



Du ingår i ett utvecklingsteam där du förväntas kunna vara delaktig i teamets teknikval och design och tillsammans med andra systemutvecklare i andra team. Du förväntas kunna röra dig från container och applikationsserver till användargränssnitt och tillsammans med övriga i teamet arbeta med kontinuerlig integration och analys. Exempel på verktyg och tekniker du kommer i kontakt med är Java, JavaScript, Vue.js, Git, OpenShift, SonarQube, NexusIQ, Docker och Kubernetes.



Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.



Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar.



Vi söker dig som


* har högskoleexamen eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
* har minst ett års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i närtid
* agerar på eget initiativ och tar ansvar för att nå goda resultat
* samarbetar effektivt med andra för att nå gemensamma mål
* har ett systematiskt och noggrant arbetssätt
* kan förstå och analysera komplexa frågor
* har god kommunikativ förmåga, i tal och skrift
* har goda kunskaper i svenska, i tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du


* har erfarenhet av Java eller annat objektorienterat språk som bedöms likvärdigt
* har erfarenhet av DevOps-principer
* har erfarenhet av containerteknik som OpenShift, Docker eller Kubernetes.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.


**Övrigt**
----------



Ett flertal tjänster, tillsvidare, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan bli aktuellt. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering. Möjlighet till distansarbete finns om arbetet tillåter. Placeringsort: Trelleborg



Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök fk.se/jobbahososs


**Kontaktpersoner**
-------------------



Chef: Petter Norman, 010-113 09 70 eller Svante Fahlström, 010-114 47 96 (för frågor om tjänsten). HR-specialist: Linnéa Palmkvist, 010-113 10 46, linnea.palmkvist@forsakringskassan.se (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen). Fackliga representanter är för ST Johan Mauritzson, Saco-S Cornelia Harder, Seko Eliza Grundström. Dessa nås via vår växel 08-786 90 00.


**Ansökan**
-----------



Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 7 december 2025. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande under rekryteringsprocessen.



Har du skyddade personuppgifter eller ingen tillgång till bank-id ringer du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.


Vi ska i allt vi gör, agera med utgångspunkt i principen om alla människors lika värde, rättssäkerhet och med god service till medborgarna.

title: Systemutvecklare, Stockholm
description:
**Organisation**It-avdelningen


**Kommun**Stockholm


**Län**Stockholms län


**Utlyst**03 november 2025


**Ansök senast**17 november 2025


**Referensnummer**A675.140/2025


**Arbetsplatsbeskrivning**
--------------------------


Polisens IT-avdelning utvecklar ständigt ny teknik för att möta brottsutvecklingen i samhället. Som systemutvecklare får du chansen att bidra till trygghet genom att skapa system för polisiära verksamheter. Med cirka 1200 anställda ansvarar vi för IT-stödet till 40 000 medarbetare och nu söker vi utvecklare till vårt kontor i Stockholm. Vi värdesätter en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder en flexibel arbetsplats med bland annat möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till två dagar i veckan.


**Arbetsbeskrivning**
---------------------


**Är du en systemutvecklare med gedigen och aktuell erfarenhet av Java och vill ha en spännande och samhällsviktig utmaning där du gör Sverige och Europa säkrare**? Vår verksamhet ansvarar för att säkerställa att polisens internationella samarbeten har bästa tänkbara IT-stöd i sitt arbete med att förebygga, hantera och förhindra grov, organiserad brottslighet med internationell koppling samt flera informationsutbytessystem som är essentiella nav i den internationella kampen mot grov brottslighet.



Vi står inför en spännande och händelserik tid med mycket nyutveckling med komponenter i teknisk framkant.



Våra team ansvarar för hela produktens livscykel. En arbetsdag kan innebära allt från att du utvecklar nya applikationer, underhåller komplexa system eller löser kritiska säkerhetsproblem. Du arbetar nära slutanvändare i den polisiära verksamheten och andra grupper inom IT för att omsätta kunskap till tekniska lösningar som stödjer polisen i deras uppdrag. Vi erbjuder goda möjligheter till personlig utveckling och uppmuntrar våra medarbetare att ständigt vidareutvecklas inom sina intresseområden.  

Du behöver ha en analytisk förmåga, vara ansvarstagande och ha ett starkt driv tillsammans med ett kreativt tänkande. Du vill hela tiden arbeta för att vi tillsammans kontinuerligt levererar så bra lösningar som möjligt. Du är en anpassningsbar lagspelare som har lätt för att samarbeta, du är även kommunikativ och kan hantera många kontaktytor.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


* Minst 3–5 års aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom systemutveckling med fokus på Java och Typescript/JS
* Utbildning inom IT, alternativt förvärvad erfarenhet som Polismyndigheten bedömer relevant
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.
* Svenskt medborgaskap

  

  

Vi ser det som **meriterande** om du utöver detta även har:


* gRPC
* Event streams, UX, GUI design
* Erfarenhet av att bygga API:er enligt ”best practice”
* Spring Boot
* MySQL, IBM MQ JMS
* Linux, Docker och/eller Kubernetes, GitOps, CI/CD pipeline på Jenkins


Med din erfarenhet förväntar vi oss att du har god förmåga att arbeta självständigt**.** Din förmåga att ta initiativ och vägleda andra är avgörande för att ständigt driva utvecklingen framåt. Du bidrar till att skapa en kultur av samarbete och kunskapsdelning, där vi strävar efter att ständigt förbättra våra processer och tekniska lösningar.


Vi värdesätter dina personliga egenskaper högt och kommer lägga stor vikt vid dessa för att hitta rätt person för rollen.



**Kontaktpersoner**
-------------------


Har du frågor om uppdraget kontakta: 0105637497  

  

eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att ta kontakt med:  

HR-konsult, Pamela Vongaribo, pamela.vongaribo@polisen.se


**Fackliga företrädare**
------------------------


Polisförbundet, Sofia Ask, tfn: 010-563 87 10  

Saco-S, nås via mejl saco-s.avdelningarna@polisen.se  

SEKO Polisen, Karna Tillheden, tfn: 010-561 66 27  

ST, Jessica Stålenkrans 010-563 32 66


**Övrig information**
---------------------


Anställningsform: Tillsvidare med 6 månaders provanställning  

Arbetsort: Stockholm  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Arbetstid: Dagtid  

Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse



Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV **(vi vill inte ha något personligt brev)** och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett. Det är därför viktigt att du svarar tydligt och utförligt på frågorna i angiven ruta och inte hänvisar till andra handlingar t.ex. CV.



Besvara följande **urvalsfrågor** som en del av din ansökan:


* Minst 3–5 års aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom systemutveckling med fokus på Java och Typescript/JS? *Om ja/beskriv din erfarenhet*
* Utbildning inom IT, alternativt förvärvad erfarenhet som Polismyndigheten bedömer relevant? *Om ja/beskriv din erfarenhet?*
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt? *Om ja/beskriv din erfarenhet*
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift? *Ja/nej?*
* Svenskt medborgaskap? *Ja/nej?*  

  

Vi ser det som **meriterande** om du utöver detta även har:

gRPC? Om ja/beskriv din erfarenhet  
* 
* Event streams, UX, GUI design? Om ja/beskriv din erfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att bygga API:er enligt ”best practice”? *Om ja/beskriv din erfarenhet*
* Spring Boot? *Om ja/beskriv din erfarenhet*
* MySQL, IBM MQ JMS? *Om ja/beskriv din erfarenhet*
* Linux, Docker och/eller Kubernetes, GitOps, CI/CD pipeline på Jenkins? *Om ja/beskriv din erfarenhet?*

  

  

Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.



De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.



Vid användning av kompletterande bedömningsmetoder såsom tester, arbetsprov eller liknande skrivs även det in under övrigt så att det framgår i annonsen.



Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och enkät via e-post till jobb.na@polisen.se senast den **17 november.** Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen. Märk din ansökan med referensnummer **A675.140/2025** i mailets ärendemening.



Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.



En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.



Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning.



Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering.



Din ansökan är en offentlig handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.  

  

#LI-Hybrid



Vi undanber oss samtal och mail från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Experienced Frontend System Developer, Lund
description:
Job Title
Experienced Frontend System Developer, Lund
Job Description*Axis Communications, the industry leader in network video, is undergoing a business transformation from a hardware-centric approach to a solution- and service-oriented model. Our Information Systems department plays a crucial role in this transition, with a strong focus on security, scalability, and availability.*
We are seeking a Frontend System Developer to join our Product Information Services team. The team is responsible for the design and development of integrated web applications used to manage and distribute product and device information. Your key responsibilities will include the development, maintenance, troubleshooting, and optimization of various Frontend components that are part of the team's solutions. Additionally, you will be part of a cross-functional team aiding in Frontend-related tasks for teams within the same section that work with software information and user login and authentication. We are looking for candidates with a strong technical background in Frontend Development. Our solutions are critical to the company, enabling the distribution of software used in our products and supporting numerous employees in their daily tasks. Be part of a collaborative environment where your contributions will have a significant impact on the company's operations.
Who is your future team?  

You will be part of a dynamic team consisting of backend and frontend system developers, test engineers, and IT product owners. Our team is known for its strong spirit, open work environment, and significant impact on the company's success. We value social activities such as daily breakfasts, common lunches, table tennis, online gaming, and after-work gatherings.
What you’ll do here as Frontend System Developer?
As a Frontend System Developer, you will be instrumental in delivering professional system solutions with a focus on long-term architecture and security. You will collaborate closely with the team on requirements, design, development, threat modeling, code reviews, testing, release planning and support. Additionally, you will participate in lunch & learn sessions and innovation days.  

Who are we looking for/Who are you?
We are looking for a driven and respectful individual who aligns with our open company culture. You should have a technical background and experience in frontend web development, with a keen interest in learning new areas and sharing your ideas.
Preferred Skills:* React
* JavaScript
* TypeScript
* Redux
* Docker
* GIT
* NodeJS and NPM
* General knowledge of REST API development

  

Additional Experience (Not Required)* DevOps
* CI/CD
* AngularJS
* Nginx

  

What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact.  

Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide.
As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.  

*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*  

Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:
Life at Axis blog
Engineering at Axis blog
Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
If you have any questions, please contact recruiting manager Stefan Liljestrand on +46 46 272 18 00. We will review all applications continuously, so please do not hesitate to apply!
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-11-24*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Senior systemutvecklare
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
Vi tror att tekniken ger oss oanade möjligheter – för att utveckla människor, skapa bättre affärer och bygga hållbara samhällen. Vi letar efter dig som vill arbeta tillsammans med Sveriges härligaste kollegor och vill vara med att hjälpa våra kunder på deras resa mot en hållbar digital utveckling.

  

***Det här är Forefront***  

Vi – Forefront – är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag som föddes 2008. Idag är vi över 500 anställda, eller Frontiers som vi hellre kallar oss. Vi har som ambition att bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats. Det gör vi genom att uppskatta varandras olikheter, ständigt blicka framåt och skapa en organisation som är lika modig som klok. Tillsammans är vi förenade av delade visioner och drivna av större ambitioner. Med kontor och Frontiers över hela Sverige strävar vi efter att få teknik och människa att gå hand i hand.


***Vem är du?***  

Vi söker dig som vill arbeta tätt tillsammans med både kunder och kollegor. Du gillar tekniska utmaningar och innovation. Vi tror också att du har arbetat som systemutvecklare eller systemarkitekt i agila leveranser under de senaste åren. Du är van att ta ansvar och att navigera ett team åt rätt håll.  

  

***Kvalifikationer***  

Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av:

  

* Mjukvaruutveckling (gärna inom Microsoftstacken och/eller JavaScript)
* Vana att utveckla hållbara system med välskriven kod i en eller flera delar av stacken
* Erfarenhet av publika molnplattformar som Azure, GCP och/eller AWS
* Långsiktiga och moderna värderingar kopplat till DevOps, DevSec, SOLID, etc
* Erfarenhet av eller intresse för konsultrollen

Kvalifikationer
***Vad kan du förvänta dig?***  

Spännande uppgifter som Senior systemutvecklare hos Forefront:

  

* Bygga och implementera högkvalitativa lösningar
* Vidareutveckla dig själv, andra och våra kunder
* Ansvara för hela leveransen, från kod till användarupplevelse
* Verka i nära samarbeten och relationer med våra kunder och andra från Forefront
* Jobba med moderna tekniker och arbetssätt


***Vi lovar dig!***


* Sveriges härligaste kollegor!
* Två kontor i Jämtland, ett i Östersund och ett i Åre. Du väljer vilket kontor du vill arbeta på, eller så kan du välja att arbeta från bägge kontoren.
* Kompetensutveckling genom en lärande kultur med stora bredder av olika kompetenser och erfarenhetsnivåer.
* En inkluderande kultur som uppmuntrar mångfald och jämställdhet.
* Flexibla arbetsformer som stödjer balansen mellan arbete och privatliv, så att du kan leverera ditt bästa både på jobbet och hemma.
* Möjlighet att delta i spännande projekt med kunder som ligger i framkant av teknikutvecklingen och arbetar med de senaste teknologierna.


**Om våra kontor**



Vi är stolta över våra kontor i centrala Åre och Östersund. Här får du inte bara arbeta med de senaste teknikerna, i spännande kundprojekt från hela Sverige. Du får även en plats i vår gemenskap. Du får självklart arbeta hemifrån om du vill, men de allra flesta av oss brukar vilja vara på kontoret för att det helt enkelt är en härlig plats att arbeta tillsammans på. Kom och se själv!  



Vi uppmuntrar särskilt ansökningar från kvinnor och andra underrepresenterade grupper inom teknologisektorn.


Om företaget
Forefront Consulting är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag med drygt 550 anställda. Med kontor på 11 orter i Sverige och USA, guidar vi företag och organisationer i det digitala landskapet och övriga transformationer.



Oavsett om uppdraget avser affärsverksamhet, teknologiska plattformar eller designlösningar är utgångspunkten alltid att först skapa en samsyn kring nödvändiga förändringar för att sedan kunna realisera dessa på bästa sätt för avsedd effekt.
company_description: Forefront builds a vibrant social impact sector for all people of Illinois.

title: Front-End Developer & Scrum Master
description:
**Front-End Developer & Scrum Master**
======================================

Functional area: Research and Development
Location: Sweden
City: Stockholm
Company name: Atlas Copco Industrial Technique AB
Date of posting: Oct 27, 2025  

Join our international software development team and shape the shared building blocks behind Atlas Copco’s customer-facing digital solutions.

  

We are looking for a Front-End Developer & Scrum Master who enjoys combining hands-on coding with agile leadership. In this role, you work closely with other developers in multiple countries to build, improve and maintain common software components used in our customer applications worldwide.

  


**Your role**


* Develop and maintain modern front-end solutions using React and Bulma
* Collaborate with Back-End Developers working in .NET, Kubernetes, and Docker environments
* Facilitate agile ceremonies and support the team as a Scrum Master, fostering collaboration and continuous improvement
* Apply and promote micro front-end architectures for scalable, maintainable front-end solutions
* Contribute to a strong DevOps culture through automation, testing, and continuous delivery practices

  


**What you bring**


* Solid experience in front-end development (React or similar frameworks)
* A good understanding of agile ways of working (Scrum, Kanban) and experience as a Scrum Master or team facilitator
* Communication skills and the ability to collaborate in a distributed, multicultural environment
* Curiosity and a problem-solving mindset – you like to simplify, improve, and make things work better
* Experience with .NET, Docker, or Kubernetes is a plus
* Fluency in English

  


**What we offer**


* An open, international work environment with colleagues across Europe and beyond
* A chance to work on foundational software components that power Atlas Copco’s global digital solutions
* Opportunities to grow both technically and as an agile leader
* Flexible working arrangements and a culture that values teamwork, innovation, and learning

  



Are you ready to combine agile leadership with hands-on development?  

Apply now and help us build the next generation of digital tools at Atlas Copco.

  


**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**  

Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.
company_description: Atlas Copco provides compressed air and gas equipment, industrial power tools, construction equipment, and industrial vacuum equipment, as well as service and maintenance. www.atlascopco.com

title: Human Software Developer
description:
Here's our job spec:
 



  





 "Code wizards wanted for hazardous journey. Low wages, bitter cold, long hours of complete darkness. Safe return doubtful. Honour and recognition in event of success"
 



  





 Life at a startup is a challenge.
 



  





 We're building the future of virtual workers from the ground up. That means a hazardous journey into unknown, long hours of complete darkness when you're hunting that last bug, and the kind of uncertainty only a fast-growing company can offer.
 



  





 In return, you'll get honour, recognition, and the chance to build something that could change everything for how companies will operate in the future.
 



  





 Are you the right person for the journey?
 



  





 Read more complete the application challange here: https://urls.vorker.ai/V3BdbgYhWw
 



  





 We plan to hire 3–6 people for this role. You will be grouped together in teams and be given projects to complete. You are expected to take ownership and be self-driving. We will have standing meetings to follow up on progress and give guidance. These are a few focus areas you will be working on:
 


* Develop new AI subagents or tools for agents
* Build observability tools for monitoring and analyzing overall system status
* Work on frontend and UX projects
* Develop and maintain CI/CD and QA pipelines
* Research and test new promising techniques



  





 It is almost mandatory that you either speak Swedish or live in Stockholm but we recognize that if you wow us, we are going to be a bit flexible.
 



  





 ---
 



 Expectations:
 


* Can start within a few weeks
* Needs to work at least 20h a week
* Positive mentality
* No ego
* You either have some work experience or you have a portfolio of cool projects you have show us
* Coding tests will be conducted.



  





 Conditions:
 


* Location: 100% Remote
* Hourly Wage: 175 SEK
* Needs to be employable in Sweden.
* Equipment: Bring your own computer
* Contract: 6-month probationary period
* If you are exceptional you can be sure that you will be rewarded.

title: Junior C++ Developer
description:
**Company Description**
 Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.
   

  

 By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.
   

  

 From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a talented C++ DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm, Sweden. In this role, you will bridge the gap between software development and operations, leveraging your expertise in C++ programming and DevOps practices to streamline our development processes and enhance our product delivery pipeline.
   

  

* Develop, maintain, and optimize C++ codebases for high-performance applications
* Design and implement robust CI/CD pipelines to automate build, test, and deployment processes
* Collaborate with development teams to improve code quality, system reliability, and scalability
* Manage and optimize containerized environments using Docker and Kubernetes
* Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues in production environments
* Develop and maintain documentation for DevOps processes and best practices
* Continuously evaluate and integrate new technologies to improve development and operations workflows
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members
* Contribute to the company's overall DevOps strategy and culture
* Work three days at the customer location or in the office


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
* 1+ years of experience in C++ development, with a strong understanding of modern C++ standards
* 1+ years of hands-on experience with DevOps practices and tools
* Proficiency in version control systems, particularly Git
* Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI
* Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix systems and shell scripting
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and their DevOps-related services
* Experience with containerization technologies, especially Docker and Kubernetes
* Knowledge of infrastructure as code principles and tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible)
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or Bash
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, ELK stack)
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities
* Understanding of agile methodologies and software development lifecycle
* Relevant DevOps certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Docker Certified Associate) are a plus


 Additional Information
   

  

 Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:
   

  

  

* Finance:
   

 Competitive salary package, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
* Career Development:
   

 Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
* Learning Opportunities:
   

 Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
* Work-Life Balance:
   

 Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
* Health:
   

 Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
* Community:
   

 Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


 At Endava, we’re committed to creating an open, inclusive, and respectful environment where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to be their best. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives—because we know that inclusive teams help us deliver smarter, more innovative solutions for our customers. Hiring decisions are based on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential. If you need adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: Web Engineer
description:
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a Web Engineer to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.* 




  





***Period:***
*ASAP to January (full-time), with a possibility of extension.* 




  





**About the role** 




 We’re looking for a Web Engineer to help design and build a shared TypeScript SDK that centralizes reusable platform libraries, tools, and best practices. This SDK will make it easier for teams across our client to integrate with internal web infrastructure, improve consistency, and accelerate development workflows.
 



  





 This role is embedded within a broader platform mission rather than a single product team. You'll work in close collaboration with internal advisors, participate in a lightweight standup cadence, and lead a focused, well-scoped project. While not part of a formal team, you’ll be supported by stakeholders across the company.
 



  





**What you'll do** 



* Design and develop a shared TypeScript SDK for use across our client's internal web stack
* Consolidate platform libraries, gRPC wrappers, and common utilities
* Engage directly with web infra teams to align on best practices and encourage adoption
* Contribute to developer experience improvements through documentation and tooling
* Join web-focused ceremonies (advisory boards, check-ins) and collaborate across platform missions



  





**Who you are** 



* Strong expertise in TypeScript, including structuring libraries and reusable modules
* Solid understanding of web infrastructure, including dependency management, build tooling, and API integration (e.g., gRPC)
* Ability to operate autonomously, navigate ambiguity, and drive alignment across teams
* Comfortable interfacing with a variety of teams and disciplines to gather input and evangelize usage
* Bonus: Experience contributing to SDKs, internal platforms, or developer experience teams



  





**We are Market Partner** 




*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like. We apply ongoing selection and may fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.*

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Javascript
* React
* Experience from bank/finance


**Application deadline:** 
 05-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: SEB Tech Trainee Programme 2026-27: Solution Developer | SEB, Stockholm
description:
**Do you want to challenge, change, and steer our company into the future? Are you passionate about technology and ready to make a difference? Then you will thrive at SEB.**
 At SEB, we believe in fresh thinking, new working methods, and innovation to create a fairer and more sustainable world. Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success, while we place a strong emphasis on sustainability and digitalization as we shape the future of SEB.
   

  

 With the Tech Trainee Programme and as an employee, we'll help you develop new skills and take on more responsibility to create a positive impact.
 **You will become a crucial key player in shaping the future of the bank.**
 Your Tech Trainee position and your team
   

  

**Join SEB’s journey to become a data-driven bank!** 
 We believe every team member has the potential to grow and make a real impact - no matter where you start.
   

  

**As a developer in SEB’s IT Asset Management team, you will** 
 be part of a dynamic and collaborative team that values continuous learning and shared responsibility.
   

  

 Our open culture encourages knowledge sharing through pair programming, problem-solving workshops, and regular ‘Demo Fridays’. The development team consists of a mix of junior and senior developers.
   

  

**In Your Role, You Will**
* Help us deliver innovative and data-driven solutions
* Be part of an Agile delivery team, contributing throughout the entire lifecycle—from design to production support
* Develop line-of-business applications with a strong focus on IT Asset management, playing a key role in delivering solutions in close collaboration with stakeholders and cross-functional teams
* Be able to work across the full stack, as the delivery area continues to grow – from database modelling and back-end development to APIs, user interfaces, and integrations with other critical systems within the bank
* Be supported by experienced colleagues and encouraged to experiment, ask questions, and develop new skills every day


**Our Tech Stack**
* .NET, C#
* Angular, TypeScript, HTML/CSS
* REST APIs
* GitHub, CI/CD
* SQL Server
* Visual Studio Professional and VS Code
* Kubernetes
* GitHub Copilot


 Simultaneously by working in the role you are being recruited to,
 **you will participate in SEB's Tech Trainee Programme for six months** 
 . It will give you the opportunity to develop an extensive network within the bank, gain a deep understanding of the financial industry and our global tech organization, and be professionally and personally challenged.
   

  

 As part of the programme, you can expect to: contribute to meaningful projects, work on tech tracks, gain communication and leadership skills, and participate in a hackathon and a business challenge.
   

  

 Key traits to thrive in this role and programme
   

  

 We’re looking for young talents who are curious, motivated, and ready to question the status quo.
   

  

**To thrive in this role and in the Tech Trainee Programme, we believe you have:**
* Graduated within the past two years, or will graduate before the programme starts on 1st September 2026 – from a relevant academic degree or a two-year vocational education in IT or tech
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to take ownership
* Great communication skills and to be able to work in English
* Some experience or interest in technologies like .NET, Angular, and REST APIs, or are motivated to learn them with our support


**We Also Believe You**
* Bring curiosity and a collaborative spirit to our team, ready to tackle challenges together
* Value teamwork, open communication, and shared responsibility


 Previous experience (part-time work, student projects, labs in IT/Tech etc.) and involvement during your studies are advantageous but
 **what matters most is your potential and passion** 
 .
   

  

 In our recruitment, SEB behaviours are something we consider when choosing whom to hire. These behaviours include creating value, acting long-term, and building positive relationships.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A six-month trainee programme, designed for professional and personal development
* A full-time employment in the role you have been hired for, after completing the programme successfully
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Networking and collaboration opportunities
* A real business challenge to solve with other participants in the Tech Trainee and International Trainee programmes, where you can create value and make a difference for SEB
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mentorship from senior leaders


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 The application period for the Tech Trainee programme is open until 11th January 2026 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact career@seb.se, but we will not process applications via e-mail.
   

  

 The Tech Trainee Programme will start on 1st September 2026.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We want to get to know you, and for you to get to know us.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Includes**
* Psychometric tests
* Interviews – digitally and/or on-site
* A case exercise and presentation
* SEB Day – an event to learn more about SEB and the programme, with insights from former trainees


 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Find out more about the Tech Trainee Programme here: Tech Programme | SEB
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Web Developer
description:
**Utveckla framtiden med oss** 




 Omegapoint är ett ledande cybersäkerhetsföretag som arbetar med säker digitalisering. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta med branchens mest erfarna experter och utveckla samhällskritiska lösningar. Vi utvecklar och förvaltar säkra system tillsammans med våra kunder och nu söker vi fler vassa utvecklare till vårt webb-team i Stockholm.
 



  





**Att jobba som webbutvecklare på Omegapoint kan exempelvis innebära att du:** 



* Utvecklar och förbättrar moderna webbapplikationer.
* Designar och implementerar användarvänliga och tillgängliga gränssnitt.
* Deltar i arkitekturdiskussioner och bidrar till tekniska vägval.
* Arbetar nära våra kunder och hjälper till att lösa komplexa tekniska utmaningar.



 För att trivas tror vi att du är utåtriktad, driven och kvalitetsmedveten. Vi ser gärna att du har en stark vilja att utvecklas och håller dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknikerna och idéerna inom domänen.
 



 Vi ser även att du är en stolt utvecklare som alltid strävar efter att skapa värde åt våra kunder. Vidare är du prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din erfarenhet och kompetens både internt och externt.
 



  





**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:** 



* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet som utvecklare och en utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande.
* Har djup erfarenhet i ett eller flera SPA-ramverk som Angular, React, Vue, och Next.js och god förståelse för modern frontend-utveckling, t.ex. TypeScript, JavaScript och komponentbaserad arkitektur.
* Är bekväm i hela stacken och har erfarenhet av backend-utveckling, t.ex. Java, .NET eller Node.js samt tekniker som Azure och/eller AWS.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska.



 Vi ser det som extra meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Angular.
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Köpenhamn, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala, Umeå och Montreal.
 



  





**Vi satsar på dig** 




 Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du ges mängder med möjligheter att fortsätta utvecklas.
 



 På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.
 



 Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.

description:

title: Software Engineer for a growing AI company
description:
Are you a Software Engineer with an interest in working on the frontline of ML and deep learning? If so, this position might be something for you!
 



  





 Join a fast-growing AI scale-up recognised as a global leader in the field. The company specializes in developing intelligent products using artificial intelligence applications on small chips (Edge AI or tinyML). They have showcased groundbreaking innovations like the world's first gesture-controlled in-ear headphones at the Embedded World conference in Germany. Now, they are looking to grow their development team!
 



  





**About the Position:** 




 As a Software Engineer, you'll have the opportunity to join a skilled product development team comprising creative and innovative Software Engineers and AI researchers. Together, they are shaping the future of Edge AI. In this role, you will play a crucial role in the advancement of the company’s Machine Learning development platform. Your focus will be on improving the desktop client, used by customers to build state-of-the-art ML applications for embedded devices. You'll collaborate with a skilled team of Software Engineers and ML researchers, working on implementing new features, enhancing user interfaces, and shortening the development life-cycle.
 



  





**What you will do?** 



* Collaborate with experienced software engineers to enhance and develop the company’s key product.
* Collaborate with ML engineers to improve their ML training module and visualise model performance.
* Write high-quality software in collaboration with other skilled engineers.
* Shape the future of AI as we know it!



  





**We are looking for someone who has...** 



* Experience of programming with C#/.NET.
* Experience in building WPF applications.
* Strong sense of ownership and a proactive approach.
* Excellent collaboration skills and the ability to work effectively in a team.
* A good level of English.



  





**It’s an extra bonus if you have…** 



* Side projects: hobbies are always a plus!
* General knowledge of object-oriented programming.
* Understanding of neural network design and proficiency in one or more ML frameworks.
* Knowledge of data analysis, statistics, signal processing, and practical applications.
* Worked with MVVM.
* Have a good level of Swedish.



  





**What’s in it for you?** 



* The opportunity to contribute to a development platform, recognised as a leader in bringing deep learning to the edge.
* A collaborative international team focused on a common goal.
* Real-world problem-solving using ML technologies.
* Competitive salary, wellness allowance, and option program.
* A flexible and open-minded company culture.
* Growth opportunities and career advancement.
* Short decision paths and a proactive work environment.
* Centrally located office in Stockholm with work-from-home flexibility.



  





 Sound interesting? Click apply!
 



  





  





*Please note that Ninox is an external recruitment partner recruiting on behalf of a client.*

title: Backend developer
description:
Remman Mobility Group is a strategic leader in the rapidly growing automotive remarketing industry. Backed by leading investors and offering competitive products, we're in an exciting growth phase. We believe our next stage of growth depends on the team we build, which is why we're looking for our next key contributor.
 




  





**About the Job** 





 As a Senior System Developer in our IT team, you will share responsibility for the backend development of our systems. You will have a central role in the team, where your main focus will be to design and then develop the services for our finance and vehicle systems.
 




  






 Our system landscape includes both customer-facing applications and internal systems, which place different demands on both you and the systems. You will also be an important part of our technology monitoring and scouting, ensuring that chosen technologies and solutions remain relevant.
 




  





**What you’ll do** 



* Designing REST services for our service platform in close collaboration with the business.
* Realizing and implementing designed services and features.
* Evaluating solutions from a scalable and security-conscious perspective.
* Ensuring our architecture is adhered to regarding policies, security requirements, and regulations.
* Collaborating closely with our frontend developers.
* Participating in our standups and contributing to knowledge sharing within the team.
* Managing incidents and taking responsibility for the entire development chain, from design to deployment.



  





**What we’re looking for** 



* 5 - 10 years of experience in designing and developing systems.
* Deep understanding of our technology stack.
* Previous experience with scalable and event-driven systems.
* Previous experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps.
* Previous experience with automated testing.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.



  





**Highly Meritorious if you also have** 



* Developed REST-based systems.
* Experience with OpenAPI.
* Experience with container orchestration.



  






 We are looking for someone who is solution-oriented and analytical, and who can communicate complex technical solutions to various target groups.
 




  





**Our tech stack** 



* Java
* Spring Framework
* Spring Webflux
* MongoDB
* Docker
* Kubernetes
* Google Cloud



  





**What we offer** 





 A fast-growing company operating in an expanding market. We use a modern tech stack where you'll have a direct say in our technical direction and workflows. Our newly renovated office in Solna offers a modern and accessible workspace.
 




  





**About Remman** 





 At Remman Mobility Group, our family of companies drives innovation and excellence across the automotive remarketing ecosystem. Our group has six companies and 120 colleagues across offices in Stockholm, Linköping, Örebro and Helsinki. Each entity is uniquely positioned to deliver specialized solutions, from cutting-edge remarketing platforms to flexible payment services and operational support. Together, we create a dynamic network that empowers OEMs, leasing companies, and dealerships to succeed in an ever-evolving industry.

title: iOS Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you driven to create exceptional
 **mobile experiences** 
 ? We're seeking skilled and motivated
 **iOS Software Engineers** 
 , both
 **Senior** 
 and
 **Mid-Level** 
 , to help shape the future of our mobile products. In this role, you'll collaborate closely with Product Managers, Engineering Managers, and cross-functional teams to bring business requirements to life on iOS, while upholding best-in-class coding standards.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, develop, and maintain robust iOS applications using Swift and UIKit, SwiftUI.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and fellow developers to define requirements and deliver user-centric features.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and help shape technical direction.
* Support and mentor team members, sharing knowledge and encouraging best practices.
* Conduct code reviews and ensure high standards of code quality and maintainability.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical challenges, including performance and concurrency issues.
* Stay current with iOS development trends and evaluate new tools and frameworks.
* Work closely with backend teams to integrate APIs and ensure seamless data flow.
* Partner with QA to ensure thorough testing and smooth deployment.
* Participate in Agile/Scrum processes, contributing to sprint planning and estimations.
* Share insights and learnings to foster a culture of continuous improvement.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Our product teams are dedicated to building advanced internal tools that support data-driven decision-making across product development. We focus on analyzing test variations, interpreting performance data, and delivering insights that help product teams optimize feature rollouts. By collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, we ensure that new features are launched efficiently and effectively. Through continuous learning and iteration, we contribute to innovation and excellence in user experience across the organization.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with...
   

  

* Swift, UIKit & SwiftUI Proficiency: Solid experience building iOS apps using Swift and SwiftUI. Senior candidates should demonstrate deep expertise and guide others in advanced UI development.
* Architecture & Design Patterns: Understanding of MVVM or similar patterns. Senior developers are expected to lead architectural decisions and design scalable solutions.
* iOS SDK Knowledge: Familiarity with key frameworks like UIKit, Core Data, and Core Animation. Senior candidates should know how to integrate these effectively with SwiftUI.
* UI/UX Collaboration: Ability to work closely with designers to deliver intuitive, polished interfaces. Seniors should provide design feedback and ensure pixel-perfect implementation.
* Performance & Optimization: Experience identifying performance bottlenecks and using tools like Instruments. Senior developers should lead to optimization efforts.
* Networking & API Integration: Comfortable working with RESTful APIs, async calls, and error handling. Seniors should design robust networking layers.
* Debugging Skills: Strong troubleshooting abilities using Xcode tools. Senior developers should handle complex issues and support others in debugging.
* Team Contribution: Mid-level developers should be collaborative and open to learning. Senior developers are expected to mentor, lead code reviews, and foster team growth.
* Communication: Clear communicators who can work effectively across teams. Senior candidates should also drive technical discussions and decision-making.


 And people who have:
   

  

* Problem-Solving Skills: A logical and creative mindset to tackle challenges and deliver effective solutions, even under pressure.
* Collaborative Spirit: The ability to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and backend developers.
* Interpersonal Communication: A clear and thoughtful approach to articulating ideas, technical concepts, and feedback, both in writing and verbally.
* Adaptability: Comfort with navigating change, learning new tools, and adjusting to evolving project needs.
* Growth Mindset: Openness to feedback and a drive to continuously improve and grow professionally.


**Who We Are**
**H&M Group** 
 is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At
 **H&M Group,** 
 we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* Staff discount card: Usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* H&M Incentive Program (HIP): Included in our HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* Competitive pensions: Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to the Swedish market.
* Generous vacation: 30 days' vacation, health care allowance, and good work-life balance.
* Additional perks: Discounts from Benify.
* Innovative Environment: Work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.
* Global Impact: Be part of a team that influences users worldwide.
* Professional Growth: Endless opportunities to learn and develop your skills.
* Collaborative Culture: Join a motivated team that values collaboration and excellence.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 This is a full-time permanent position, starting as soon as possible according to the agreement. The role is a hybrid position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here. We are eager to meet you!
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Senior Java developer
description:
**Är du en erfaren Javautvecklare som söker nya utmaningar?**
 Hos B3 Innovation får du möjligheten att arbeta i en miljö där innovation och samarbete står i fokus. Vi söker dig med djup kunskap inom Java och som trivs i en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Om rollen som Javautvecklare på B3 Innovation**
 Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* Utveckla högkvalitativa och skalbara lösningar.
* Samarbeta med ett tvärfunktionellt team av experter.
* Delta i design och arkitektur av nya system.


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har god erfarenhet och arbetat som utvecklare under en längre tid. Du som har hunnit både göra misstag och även lära av dem. Förhoppningsvis tycker du om att arbeta i team, dela med dig av dina kunskaper och vill fortsätta att lära dig nytt.
   

  

 Våra krav för att du ska passa i denna roll:
   

  

* Du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av Javautveckling.
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med Java, Kotlin, Spring, Microservices (gärna i CI/CD-miljö)
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med olika ramverk som React, Angular och Vue.
* Du har ett öga för detaljer och brinner för att leverera kvalitativa lösningar.
* Du är bekväm med moderna utvecklingsmetoder som Agile och DevOps.
* Har du dessutom kunskaper inom Techlead blir vi extra glada!


 Varför B3 Innovation?
   

  

* Innovativ Kultur: Vi uppmuntrar kreativitet och nya idéer.
* Inkluderande miljö: Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter en arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna.
* Balans och flexibilitet: Flexibilitet är centralt, vilket gör att du kan forma din arbetsdag för att få livspusslet att gå ihop. Vi förstår vikten av balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder därför flexibla arbetstider.
* Gemenskap: Hos oss blir du en del av ett stöttande team som arbetar tillsammans för att nå gemensamma mål. Det handlar inte bara om “jobb jobb jobb” hos oss. Vi anordnar allt från tech-workshops till sociala aktiviteter som stickcaféer, spelkvällar och AW.


**Om B3 Innovation**
 Vi är kända för vårt fokus på innovation och förmåga att leverera värde till våra kunder. Genom att kombinera djup teknisk expertis med en stark förståelse för våra kunders verksamhet, skapar vi lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Vår kultur bygger på öppenhet, samarbete och en passion för teknik.
   

  

 Vi prioriterar personlig utveckling och erbjuder verktyg som B3 Academy, TechTalks och "Lunch & Learn" för att du ska kunna växa.
   

  

 Upptäck möjligheterna med B3 Innovation. Som utvecklare får du arbeta inom spännande branscher som media, bank och finans, energi, offentlig sektor, telekom och e-handel. Oavsett om du optimerar TV-sändningar, utvecklar digitala banktjänster eller skapar smarta hem, hjälper vi dig att hitta det perfekta uppdraget som matchar dina intressen.
   

  

 Våra toppbetyg i medarbetarundersökningar visar att nöjda kollegor är kärnan i vår framgång. Är du redo att kliva in i en miljö där utveckling och trivsel går hand i hand?
   

  

 Som sagt, välkommen till B3 Innovation – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Är du redo att ta nästa steg?**
 Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade och innovativa team!
   

  

 Om du är mer nyfiken på oss så kan du läsa mer om oss här: https://www.b3.se/innovation
   

  

 Om du har funderingar så hör gärna av dig till Kenneth Andersson på +46706678050 alternativt mail kenneth.andersson@b3.se

title: Front-End Developer & Scrum Master
description:
Join our international software development team and shape the shared building blocks behind Atlas Copco’s customer-facing digital solutions.
   

  

 We are looking for a Front-End Developer & Scrum Master who enjoys combining hands-on coding with agile leadership. In this role, you work closely with other developers in multiple countries to build, improve and maintain common software components used in our customer applications worldwide.
   

  

**Your role**
* Develop and maintain modern front-end solutions using React and Bulma
* Collaborate with Back-End Developers working in .NET, Kubernetes, and Docker environments
* Facilitate agile ceremonies and support the team as a Scrum Master, fostering collaboration and continuous improvement
* Apply and promote micro front-end architectures for scalable, maintainable front-end solutions
* Contribute to a strong DevOps culture through automation, testing, and continuous delivery practices


**What You Bring**
* Solid experience in front-end development (React or similar frameworks)
* A good understanding of agile ways of working (Scrum, Kanban) and experience as a Scrum Master or team facilitator
* Communication skills and the ability to collaborate in a distributed, multicultural environment
* Curiosity and a problem-solving mindset – you like to simplify, improve, and make things work better
* Experience with .NET, Docker, or Kubernetes is a plus
* Fluency in English


**What We Offer**
* An open, international work environment with colleagues across Europe and beyond
* A chance to work on foundational software components that power Atlas Copco’s global digital solutions
* Opportunities to grow both technically and as an agile leader
* Flexible working arrangements and a culture that values teamwork, innovation, and learning


 Are you ready to combine agile leadership with hands-on development?
   

  

 Apply now and help us build the next generation of digital tools at Atlas Copco.
   

  

**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**
 Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
**Job Title: ServiceNow CSDM Developer** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden - Hybrid: 2-3 Days to Office Every Week** 




**Duration: 6 Months - Extendable** 




**Employment Type: Contract B2B** 




  





**Roles & Responsibilities:** 




 We are looking for a ServiceNow CSDM Developer to join our CMDB team and the design and enhancement of our Common Service Data Model (CSDM) and CMDB.
 



**Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement CSDM-aligned CMDB structures and relationships.
* Configure and manage Application Services, Business Applications, and Service Offerings.
* Support Discovery, Service Mapping, and integrations across other servicenow modules and discovery tool like ITOM and BMC Remedy.
* Develop scripts, workflows, and dashboards to improve data quality and automation.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive service visibility and data governance.



**Requirements:** 



* 5+ years of hands-on experience with ServiceNow CMDB and CSDM (v3.0 or later).
* Strong skills in JavaScript, Glide API, and ServiceNow configuration.
* Solid understanding of ITIL v4 and ServiceNow platform architecture.
* Experience in data modeling, CI class design, and CMDB health improvements.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills ,able to explain complex models in simple terms
* **ServiceNow certifications (CIS–CMDB, CIS–Discovery, CSA) preferred.**

title: Control Application Engineer, Västerås
description:
**🚀 Join VIPAS AB as a Control Application Engineer - Entry/intermediate level🚀**
**Are you ready to thrive in the dynamic world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB is on the lookout for passionate, driven professionals to join our growing team and take on exciting new projects across Sweden.**
 🌟 About VIPAS AB
   

  

 At VIPAS AB, we believe technology should empower businesses—not complicate them. We’re an IT consulting company that delivers smart, scalable, and tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java, Python, and Cloud platforms. Our expertise spans: Software Development, DevOps & Automation, Embedded Systems, Manufacturing Enginering, Mechanical Enginering, Android & Mobile Solutions, Project Management & Engineering and so on.
   

  

 We’re not just consultants—we’re strategic partners guiding organizations through digital transformation with confidence and clarity.
   

  

 💼 Your Role
   

  

 As a Consultant at VIPAS AB, you’ll work as a control Application Engineer within Power Quality, you will be responsible for the control functionality of FACTS devices in high-impact delivery projects. You will be involved throughout the entire project lifecycle—from design and implementation to verification and commissioning—and collaborate with experts across multiple engineering disciplines.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Design & Development Design, implement, and verify power control algorithms and logic for FACTS devices.
* Create, modify, debug, test, and deploy control algorithms.
* Design and test control logic, including PI/PID or similar control algorithms.
* Apply function block programming techniques.
* Testing & Verification Perform combined testing of control system software and hardware.
* Conduct Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) testing using real-time simulators.
* Prepare customer submittals and test procedures.
* Participate in factory acceptance tests and provide technical support.
* Collaboration & Customer Interaction Work closely with SCADA, HMI, Network, Cyber Security, and other engineering teams.
* Understand customer needs by reviewing specifications and participating in meetings.
* Maintain extensive contact with engineering groups, lead engineers, and customers.


**Requirements:**
* Understanding of FACTS applications.
* Knowledge of control theory and power electronics.
* Experience with simulation tools such as MATLAB or real-time simulators.
* Familiarity with signal processing, active/reactive power concepts is a plus.


**Qualifications**
* BSc or MSc in Engineering with specialization in Control Systems, Power Systems, Automatic Control Theory, Software Engineering, or similar.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is an advantage but not mandatory.
* Experience with MACH™ system is a plus.
* Ability to work independently and in teams, with a strong sense of responsibility.


 🌟 Why VIPAS AB?
   

  

 At VIPAS AB, we don’t just offer jobs—we build careers. Here’s why top IT professionals choose us:
   

  

* 📄 Secure & Transparent Employment We follow the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement, ensuring fair compensation, benefits, and long-term stability.
* 🌍 Diverse Industry Exposure Work on high-impact projects across Telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking, gaining experience that spans multiple sectors.
* 🚀 Accelerated Career Growth Whether you're a seasoned developer or an emerging tech leader, we offer continuous learning, challenging assignments, and leadership opportunities to help you grow fast and grow smart.
* 🤝 Culture of Collaboration & Curiosity Join a team that values innovation, inclusion, and integrity. At VIPAS, your ideas matter, your voice is heard, and your growth is celebrated.


 📬 How to Apply
   

  

 Ready to make an impact? Send your
 **resume and cover letter**

title: Software Security Developer
description:
**Utveckla framtiden med oss** 




 Omegapoint är ett ledande cybersäkerhetsföretag som arbetar med säker digitalisering. Här får du möjlighet att jobba med branchexperter och samhällsviktiga tjänster. Vi utvecklar och förvaltar säkra system och lösningar för våra kunder. Våra konsulter arbetar med allt från infrastruktur och DevOps till avancerad systemutveckling – där säkerhet och assurans genomsyrar allt. Nu utökar vi vårt team med fler Software Security Developers.
 



  





**Att jobba som Software Security Developer på Omegapoint kan exempelvis innebära att du:** 



* Stöttar utvecklingsteam i allt som rör applikationssäkerhet, från planering till implementation.
* Sätter upp användning av säkerhetsverktyg i pipelines.
* Analyserar och förklarar säkerhetsfynd, till exempel relaterade till vanliga sårbarheter som beskrivs i OWASP top 10.
* Är involverad i genomförande av hotmodelleringar.
* Granskar säkerheten i applikationer eller molnmiljöer.
* Hjälper till att utveckla eller skripta mindre komponenter.



  





 För att trivas tror vi att du är utåtriktad, driven och kvalitetsmedveten. Vi ser gärna att du har en stark vilja att utvecklas och håller dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknikerna och idéerna inom domänen.
 



 Vi ser även att du är en stolt utvecklare som alltid strävar efter att skapa värde åt våra kunder. Vidare är du prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din erfarenhet och kompetens både internt och externt.
 



  





**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:** 



* Har minst tre års erfarenhet och en utbildning inom systemutveckling, datavetenskap eller cybersäkerhet.
* Har förståelse för kombinationen av utveckling och säkerhet.
* Har erfarenhet av att utveckla i exempelvis Java, C# eller Python.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska.



  





  





**Om oss** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala, Umeå och Montreal.
 



  





**Vi satsar på dig** 




 Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du ges mängder med möjligheter att fortsätta utvecklas.
 



 På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.
 



 Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.

title: Security Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

**The role**
 At Legora, securing our platform means
 **engineering security from from day one** 
 — not bolting it on later. We’re looking for a
 **Security Engineer** 
 who can think like an attacker, build like a developer, and operate like an SRE. You’ll work across our whole tech stack, from Azure cloud infrastructure to JavaScript and Python services, to our AI integrations and workflows. You'll help make sure everything we ship is secure-by-default and resilient to evolving threats.
   

  

 This is a hands-on, technical role where you’ll be building tooling, embedding in product squads, and solving hard security problems at scale. You’ll work alongside our Head of Security, engineers, and product teams to design, implement, and maintain robust security controls while enabling rapid, safe innovation.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Embed security into our software development lifecycle; conduct design reviews, threat modeling, and secure code reviews for our JavaScript and Python codebases.
* Architect and implement security controls for our Azure cloud infrastructure, ensuring Zero Trust principles in identity, network, and service-to-service communication.
* Build and maintain secure-by-default tooling, templates, and guardrails for our developers.
* Protect AI workflows by designing and build defenses against prompt injection, data leakage, and abuse.
* Develop and maintain vulnerability management pipelines (SAST, DAST, dependency scanning), triaging and driving fixes with engineering teams.
* Automate security processes in CI/CD, including secret scanning, artifact signing, and policy-as-code checks.
* Partner with our information security team to ensure compliance and automate evidence collection efforts.


**Who You Are**
* You have 3+ years in a security engineering, product security, or DevSecOps role, ideally in a cloud-first, high-growth tech environment.
* You are fluent in at least one programming language (JavaScript preferred) and comfortable reading/writing production code.
* You have hands-on experience securing cloud environments (Azure strongly preferred) and working with Infrastructure-as-Code (Pulumi, Terraform, or similar).
* You understand Zero Trust architecture and can design systems with identity-centric, least-privilege access controls.
* You have experience with secure SDLC practices, application security testing, and vulnerability management.
* You have worked on or are curious about securing AI/ML workflows, with an interest in adversarial ML threats and mitigations.
* You thrive in cross-functional work, explaining security risks to engineers, influencing design choices, and collaborating to deliver secure features on time.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
