title: Rail engineers in Sweden
description:
***COMPETENCE and PASSION for Technology***




  





*IKOS is the European leading consulting firm specialized in* 
***railway engineering***
*. We are committed to participate in the* 
***ecological transition***
*and to develop the means of transportation of the future that are safe and durable. With 1500 consultants on our team, supported by our R&D hub IKOS Lab, we provide you the opportunity of an* 
***international career in a multicultural environment***
*. The Group currently holds 27 offices in 13 countries. Since our launch in 2005, we strive for excellence to meet our clients’ needs in signaling and control systems, rolling stock, low voltage and telecoms, energy and high voltage, as well as infrastructures and tracks.* 




  





**Context** 




  





 To keep working on IKOS’ growth and strengthen our engineering department, we are recruiting
 **signalling and rolling stock engineers** 
 with relevant experience in the field, keen to work on strategic projects in the railway sector.
 



  





**We'd love you to apply if:** 




  




* You hold an engineering degree (Bachelor's or Master's Degree) – compulsory!
* You speak both Swedish and English at a business fluent level – compulsory!
* You already have relevant experience in the railway field
* You have knowledge in interlocking systems (RSTW/ESTW) and/or signaling subsystems (point machines, signal heads, level crossings…)
* You have knowledge in rolling stock and/or related systems and subsystems (TCMS, HVAC, doors, brakes…)
* You have knowledge in railway standards and norms like EN 50126/8/9



  





**Our values:** 




  





*IKOS is human centered and built on strong values* 




  




* **Passion:** 
 Our enthusiasm for new technology and continuous research and innovation drives the day-to-day work of our engineers
* **Respect:** 
 Trust and mutual esteem, linked with equality and diversity, allow us to construct our future together
* **Team Spirit:** 
 This value is fundamental in our approach to our profession. It allows us to implement both large-scale and high-tech projects with our unique team
* **Excellence:** 
 Resolving the societal challenges relating to transport requires and deserves the best of ourselves. Fortified by our convictions, excellence remains at the heart of our work.



  





**Why Join Us?** 




  




* **Career Growth & Development:** 
 We offer tailored career plans, ongoing professional development, and clear progression pathways thanks to our
 *IKOS Accademy* 
 .
* **High-Impact Projects:** 
 Work on pioneering railway and/or energy projects alongside industry leaders worldwide.
* **International Experience:** 
 Here it is possible! Work with top global clients and (if interested) gain hands-on international exposure through exciting projects and assignments abroad.
* **Collaborative Culture:** 
 Be part of a friendly/professional and collaborative Team that values passion, respect, and
 *peer support.*
* **Competitive Benefits:** 
 We offer a comprehensive benefits package to support your health, happiness, and career journey with us (health allowance, phone, breakfast in office, monthly activities with team, home office, and much more).



  





*Get on the right Track!* 
 🚆
 



  





*Join us and start to play an active role in* 
***sustainability***
*by developing modes of transport for* 
***a greener future!***




  





*We thank all applicants for their interest however only those under consideration will be contacted.* 




  





*Recognized yourself? Then do not hesitate to apply!* 




  





 #sweden

title: IT System Administrator
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

**The role**
 At Legora, technology is at the heart of everything we do. Our teams move fast, and they need reliable, secure, and scalable systems to deliver their best work. That’s where you come in.
   

  

 We are now looking for an
 **IT System Administrator** 
 to own and evolve our internal IT environment. From managing core infrastructure and SaaS platforms to ensuring smooth onboarding experiences and bulletproof security practices, you will be the go-to person for keeping our systems running and our people empowered. This is a hands-on, high-impact role where you’ll balance operational excellence with forward-looking improvements that support our rapid growth.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Manage and administer core IT systems including Google Workspace, Slack, Okta (or equivalent), and other SaaS platforms critical to daily operations.
* Drive, manage, and implement new systems and tools that support company growth and improve operational efficiency.
* Own device management for apple devices, including configuration, deployment, patching.
* Develop and maintain internal IT processes (onboarding, offboarding, access management, license tracking) for scalability and efficiency.
* Build automation and integrations across systems using APIs to streamline workflows and reduce manual work.
* Work closely with the Security team to implement Zero Trust principles, identity and access management, and compliance controls.
* Provide technical support and guidance to employees, troubleshooting issues across applications, devices, and services.


**Who You Are**
* You have 3+ years of experience in IT administration, system operations, or similar roles in a fast-moving tech environment.
* Deep expertise in the Apple ecosystem — macOS and iOS administration, Apple Business Manager, MDM tools (e.g., Kandji, Jamf, Intune), and endpoint security. Strong knowledge of Google Workspace, identity and access management (Okta, Entra or similar), and SaaS management best practices.
* Hands-on experience with APIs and scripting (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate processes and integrate systems.
* Familiarity with compliance frameworks (ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR) and how IT operations support them. Strong problem-solving mindset with a focus on automation, efficiency, and user experience.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to build trust as a reliable point of contact across the organization.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

* A team player, with a customer-focused and positive attitude – you will often collaborate across functions and with different stakeholders
* Independent, take initiative as well as you enjoy working in a complex or fast-paced environment


 Previous experience (part-time work, life abroad etc.) and involvement during your studies are advantageous but
 **what matters most is your potential and passion** 
 .
   

  

 In our recruitment, SEB behaviours are something we consider when choosing whom to hire. These behaviours include creating value, acting long-term, and building positive relationships.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A nine-month trainee programme, designed for professional and personal development
* A full-time employment in the role you have been hired for, after completing the programme successfully
* A real business challenge to solve with other participants in the International Trainee and Tech Trainee programmes, where you can create value and make a difference for SEB
* International exposure with opportunities to work at SEB offices in other countries
* A caring, supportive and respectful culture
* Chances to make an impact on social or environmental issues
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mentorship from senior leaders
* Agile and modern ways of working


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 The application period for the International Trainee programme is open until 11th January 2026 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact career@seb.se, but we will not process applications via e-mail.
   

  

 The International Trainee programme will start on 1st September 2026.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We want to get to know you, and for you to get to know us.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Includes**
* Psychometric tests
* Interviews – digitally and/or on-site
* A case exercise and presentation
* SEB Day – an event to learn more about SEB and the programme, with insights from former trainees


 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Find out more about the International Trainee Programme here: International Trainee Programme | SEB
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 As a Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll play a key role in turning data-driven insights into impactful, real-world solutions. You’ll help shape how AI and ML are applied across our supply chain, working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative, high-quality systems that support smarter and more sustainable ways of working.
   

  

**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**
* Contribute and deliver AI/ML initiatives involving multiple stakeholders, helping ensure the timely delivery of high-quality solutions.
* Build and implement scalable, reliable ML solutions by following established technical direction and engineering best practices.
* Contribute to technical excellence and innovation by collaborating within your team and across departments to improve engineering practices.
* Identify technical risks and dependencies within your workstream and collaborate with your team and manager to address them.
* Collaborate closely with senior engineers and data scientists to translate models and concepts into production-ready systems.
* Support and maintain deployed ML systems, including monitoring, debugging, and continuous improvement.


**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH:**
 You’ll work closely with other machine learning engineers, data scientists, data analysts, solution architects, business stakeholders, and engineering managers to build and enhance AI-powered products that drive innovation and efficiency across the supply chain.
   

  

**WHO YOU ARE:**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* Experience with programming languages, tools, and frameworks relevant to AI/ML development (e.g., Python, scikit-learn, TensorFlow/PyTorch).
* Good understanding of MLOps principles, including testing, monitoring, and supporting production systems.
* Solid understanding of system design, performance optimization, and security principles for building robust AI/ML solutions.
* Knowledge across data engineering, software engineering, and data science to enable effective cross-functional collaboration.
* Ability to break down technical tasks into actionable steps and clearly communicate your progress.


**Also preferred if you have:**
* Hands-on experience with mathematical optimization techniques.


**And People Who Have...**
* Strong collaboration and teamwork skills, with the ability to foster a positive and productive environment.
* Curiosity and a desire to continuously improve engineering practices and your own technical skills.
* Good communication skills to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* The ability to navigate ambiguity and take a structured, step-by-step approach to achieve meaningful outcomes.


 The role is
 **onsite** 
 in our office in Stockholm (4 days in office, 1 day at home).
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 At H&M, you’ll be part of a dynamic global team working on one of the most business-critical platforms. This is an opportunity to take on end-to-end technical ownership of a complex system, collaborate across international teams, and contribute directly to how H&M continues to innovate in the fashion and retail space.
   

  

 We offer a collaborative workplace, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to make a tangible impact in one of the world’s leading retail organizations.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: SEB Tech Trainee Programme 2026-27: Telephony Cloud Engineer | SEB, Stockholm
description:
**Do you want to challenge, change, and steer our company into the future? Are you passionate about technology and ready to make a difference? Then you will thrive at SEB.**
 At SEB, we believe in fresh thinking, new working methods, and innovation to create a fairer and more sustainable world. Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success, while we place a strong emphasis on sustainability and digitalization as we shape the future of SEB.
   

  

 With the Tech Trainee Programme and as an employee, we'll help you develop new skills and take on more responsibility to create a positive impact.
 **You will become a crucial key player in shaping the future of the bank.**
 Your Tech Trainee position and your team
   

  

 We believe that modern cloud solutions enable smarter ways of working with data and help us deliver innovative telephony services to our customers. We are on a journey to modernize our infrastructure and transition toward cloud-based solutions.
   

  

**Skills**
 You will join a senior team and contribute to the development of our future telephony platform.
 **You’ll gain hands-on experience and grow your skills in** 
 :
   

  

* Infrastructure planning and cloud readiness
* Understanding telephony systems and services
* Collaborating with stakeholders and technical teams
* Supporting automation and operational best practices


 Our team delivers corporate telephony, digital meeting, and contact center services to over 16,000 users across 20 countries. We’re continuously evolving our services to provide the best possible experience for SEB employees and our end customers.
   

  

 Simultaneously by working in the role you are being recruited to,
 **you will participate in SEB's Tech Trainee Programme for six months** 
 . It will give you the opportunity to develop an extensive network within the bank, gain a deep understanding of the financial industry and our global tech organization, and be professionally and personally challenged.
   

  

 As part of the programme, you can expect to: contribute to meaningful projects, work on tech tracks, gain communication and leadership skills, and participate in a hackathon and a business challenge.
   

  

 Key traits to thrive in this role and programme
   

  

 We’re looking for young talents who are curious, motivated, and ready to question the status quo.
   

  

**To thrive in this role and in the Tech Trainee Programme, we believe you have:**
* Graduated within the past two years, or will graduate before the programme starts on 1st September 2026 – from a relevant academic degree or a two-year vocational education in IT or tech
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to take ownership
* Great communication skills and to be able to work in English
* Computer Science, Information Technology, of Software Engineering
* Cloud computing or DevOps
* Experience with programming, cloud platforms, or telephony systems is a plus - but not required.


 Most importantly, you're motivated to grow and contribute to real-world projects in a collaborative environment.
   

  

 Previous experience (part-time work, student projects, labs in IT/Tech etc.) and involvement during your studies are advantageous but
 **what matters most is your potential and passion** 
 .
   

  

 In our recruitment, SEB behaviours are something we consider when choosing whom to hire. These behaviours include creating value, acting long-term, and building positive relationships.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A six-month trainee programme, designed for professional and personal development
* A full-time employment in the role you have been hired for, after completing the programme successfully
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Networking and collaboration opportunities
* Hands-on experience with real-world cybersecurity challenges.
* A real business challenge to solve with other participants in the Tech Trainee and International Trainee programmes, where you can create value and make a difference for SEB
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mentorship from senior leaders


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 The application period for the Tech Trainee programme is open until 11th January 2026 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact career@seb.se, but we will not process applications via e-mail.
   

  

 The Tech Trainee Programme will start on 1st September 2026.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We want to get to know you, and for you to get to know us.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Includes**
* Psychometric tests
* Interviews – digitally and/or on-site
* A case exercise and presentation
* SEB Day – an event to learn more about SEB and the programme, with insights from former trainees


 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

title: Experienced professionals to our Logistics & Distribution practice (Stockholm and Malmö)
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax, and related services. During its 175-year history, our organization has grown tremendously in both scale and capabilities. Deloitte currently has approximately 457,000+ people in more than 150 countries and territories, and serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Yet, our shared culture and mission - to make an impact that matters - remains unchanged. This is evident not only in Deloitte’s work for clients, but also in our WorldClass ambition, our WorldClimate initiative and our ALL IN diversity and inclusion strategy.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

**Are you passionate about Supply Chain and eager to help clients navigate complex challenges at a leading management consulting firm?**




 Deloitte is looking for experienced professionals to join our Logistics & Distribution team in Sweden. We work with both global and local organizations in transforming and improving their logistics and distribution. We are known in the market for working close with senior management, operations as well as with IT at our clients.
   

  

  





 As an experienced Logistics & Distribution professional, you will be an integral part of innovative transformation projects, working directly with companies across various industries. We work across the end-to-end supply chain, mainly in the domains of logistic network design, warehouse design and operations, inventory rationalization, transport management and order management. Your main responsibilities will include:
   

  

  




* Design and implement best practice logistics & distribution transformation capabilities, processes and operating models
* Support clients in selecting and implementing technologies such as warehouse management systems, transport management systems, and order management systems
* Drive client engagements and manage project delivery


**Qualifications**

 To succeed in these roles, you have a strategic mindset, strong customer focus and experience from Logistics & Distribution and relevant technologies such as WMS, TMS, and OMS. Understanding customer requirements, business processes, end-to-end solutions, and organizational challenges is essential. We believe that you thrive in an international environment, have a broad experience and knowledge in several areas, are curious to learning and enjoy working team based.
   

  

  




* 2+ years of working experience from leading management consultant firm is a strong merit
* Relevant professional and/or project experience from logistics & distribution transformation and implementation projects. We value industry knowledge and subject matter expertise
* Strong leadership skills with experience leading teams in projects or in line organization
* Ability to lead and direct interaction with clients primarily in client-facing roles
* Understanding of end-to-end business process, best practices, and latest industry trends
* Solid project and program management skills (advisory, strategy, presentation, problem solving, coordination)
* Experience from logistics & distribution system providers such as Infor, Manhattan, Blue Yonder, and SAP
* Business sense, problem solving and analytical skills
* Professional level of English and Swedish in oral and written communication
* Travel flexibility


**Additional Information**

**We offer**




 At Deloitte, we are committed to helping our employees grow and develop throughout their career. We offer a range of on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University, and access to a personal coach to support you in identifying and utilizing your strengths. We also provide the necessary training and resources for you to obtain various certifications to further advance in your career.
   

  

  





 Our culture is built on collaboration and innovation. We value diverse perspectives and encourage our employees to think creatively to find the best solutions for our clients. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to understand their unique needs and to develop tailored solutions that drive growth and innovation. At Deloitte, you´ll have the chance to grow and succeed alongside like-minded professionals who share your passion.
   

  

  





**How to apply**




 Your application should consist of a CV and a cover letter and you apply directly online. Please apply as soon as possible as we will review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.
   

  

  





**Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis.** 
  

  

  





*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with To Find Out. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*




**Questions?**




 For questions regarding the application process, please contact Viktor Bornebusch Lundeberg, vbornebusch@deloitte.se
   

  

  





**We are looking forward to your application!**




 For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Founding Full-Stack Engineer
description:
**Company Description** 




 Meet the next Swedish unicorn straight from the streets of Stockholm sitting at SSE Business Lab
 



  





 Pango is building the world's first Agentic Operating System for e-commerce logistics. Our vision is to create the AI e-commerce employee of the future.
 



  





 While deliveries and returns are a hidden and often tedious aspect of e-commerce, we are bringing innovation to a legacy $90 billion industry.
 



  





 When we started, we already had 39 competitors in the Nordics. Yet, just two months after launching, we achieved product-market fit and are now powering million-dollar brands with our product.
 



  






 We’re building the future with those who want to say “I was there when it all started.”
 




  





**The Role** 




  





 You'll be our 
 **first engineering hire** 
 , working directly with the founding team to build the core product. This isn't a "take a ticket and ship it" role. You'll shape our technical direction, architecture, and engineering culture. You will would offer competetive equity + Salary!
 



  





**What you'll do** 



* Build and own full-stack features end-to-end in our web application
* Design, orchestrate and implement AI-powered workflows that proactively surface logistics issues and insights
* Architect scalable systems using our modern stack: Laravel, MySQL, Solr, Redis
* Work with MCP servers and LLM integrations to make e-commerce operations intelligent and contextual
* Build integrations with tools e-commerce teams already use (WMS, carriers, customer experience, etc.)
* Ship fast, iterate based on user feedback, and help define what "delightful logistics operations" looks like
* Make key technical decisions that will impact the product for years to come



  





**Our stack** 




 We work with modern, proven technologies:
 


* **Frontend:** 
  React, JavaScript/TypeScript, Polaris, Mantine, Tailwind CSS, Playwright/Cypress
* **Backend:** 
  Laravel, Pest, MySQL, Solr, Redis, RabbitMQ, Pub/Sub
* **AI/ML:** 
  AI SDKs, MCPs, agentic workflows
* **Infrastructure:** 
  GCP, CI/CD
* **Integrations:** 
  WMS, Customer Success, Carriers



  





**How we work** 



* **Ship fast, learn faster:** 
  We're building and iterating based on real user feedback
* **Own your work:** 
  From idea to deployment, you'll drive features end-to-end
* **User obsession:** 
  We're solving real problems for real people who are overwhelmed by logistics complexity
* **Pragmatic quality:** 
  We write clean code with high separation of concerns, but we don't over-engineer
* **Transparent by default:** 
  Everyone knows what everyone's working on, and why



  





**What we're looking for** 




 We care about 
 **what you can do and who you are** 
 , not where you went to school.
 



  





**Must-haves** 



* Strong experience in modern PHP/Laravel or string experience in JavaScript/TypeScript and React
* Comfortable working across the entire stack, from database schema to UI polish
* Track record of shipping products users actually use
* Excited about AI/LLM applications and willing to dive deep into this space
* Thrives in ambiguity and can figure things out independently
* Based in (or willing to relocate to) Stockholm



  





**Nice-to-haves** 



* Experience with Shopify, Magento, or similar modern e-commerce platforms
* Experience building integrations with shipping carriers and warehouse systems
* Worked at an early-stage startup before (0-10 people)
* Background B2B SaaS



  





**Most importantly** 




  




* **Owner mentality:** 
  You take initiative, see problems before they become problems, and drive projects to completion
* **User empathy:** 
  You genuinely care about building something people love using
* **Scrappy and resourceful:** 
  You get things done with limited resources and don't need everything to be perfect
* **Comfortable with uncertainty:** 
  Pre-seed startups are chaotic. You're energized by that, not scared of it



  





**What we offer** 




  




* **Competitive salary** 
  that reflects your experience and position
* **Significant equity** 
  as a founding team member you'll have meaningful ownership
* **Direct impact:** 
  Your work will shape the product, company, and culture from day one
* **Work with the founding team:** 
  No layers of management, just direct collaboration with people who care deeply about what we're building
* **Beautiful office** 
  at the SSE Business Lab in the heart of Stockholm
* **Flexibility:** 
  We're on-site preferred but understand life happens. We're humans building for humans



  





**Interview process** 




  





 1. 
 **Quick intro call** 
  (30 min) - Let's see if there's a mutual fit
 



 2. 
 **Technical conversation** 
  (60 min) - Talk code, architecture, and how you think about building products
 



 3. 
 **Meet the founders** 
  (60 min) - Get to know the team and ask us anything
 



 4. 
 **Offer** 
  - If we're both excited, let's make it official
 



  





 We move fast and will get back to you as soon as possible at each stage.
 



  





**Sound like you?** 




  





 Send us:
 


* A few paragraphs about why this role excites you
* Links to stuff you've built (GitHub, side projects, portfolio, whatever you're proud of)
* Your LinkedIn or CV if you have one (not required)



  





 We read every application ourselves. No recruiters, no AI screening filter.
 



  





*We're building Pango with humor, integrity, and ambition. That means having fun even when it's hard, treating each other with decency and respect, and thinking from first principles about what we create together. We welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives who share these values.* 




  





**For more information or questions please contact us at** 
  Steve@trypango.ai or phone number +46790240201

title: Junior system developer
description:
Join Euro Accident as our next junior system developer!
 



  





**Are you a dedicated junior system developer ready to build and deliver smart digital solutions that support our business needs? Do you want to work in an environment where care, initiative, and innovation shape everyday life? If so, this might be the perfect role for you. Read on to learn more about what we offer.** 




  





 Insurance and health make a winning combination! Through early interventions, strong partnerships, and smart digital services, Euro Accident has redefined what insurance can be from financial protection to promoting quality of life and Sustainable Employees. Today, almost half a million people have security through us. We’re proud of our satisfied customers, strong reputation, and the contribution we make to society. Now we’re growing to help even more and are looking for someone who wants to be part of our continued success story.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As a junior system developer, you will:
 


* Develop and implement scalable and reliable frontend applications using modern technologies.
* Troubleshoot and debug to ensure high-quality software delivery.
* Stay current with the latest technologies and industry trends to continuously improve our processes and solutions.



  





 At Euro Accident’s IT department, you’ll join a diverse team of 85 colleagues across our offices in Stockholm, Växjö, and Belgrade offering valuable international exposure. You’ll work closely with our developers, architect, and software development manager in a collaborative and innovative environment that values teamwork, knowledge sharing, and continuous improvement.
 



  





 The development team in Stockholm currently consists of eight dedicated developers, and together we strive to achieve great results while having fun along the way.
 



  





  





**Who you are** 




 You identify with our values: care, initiative and innovation and you are eager to learn more about our business and how you can contribute to helping our customers live sustainably and healthily.
 



  





**We believe you have:** 



* 1-3 years of professional experience in JavaScript frameworks (such as React) and CSS frameworks.
* Some experience with C#.
* Experience building scalable and responsive web applications.
* Understanding of APIs.
* Experience with Git version control.



  





**It’s a plus if you also have:** 



* Experience working with a CMS.
* A university degree in software engineering or a related field.
* Swedish language proficiency.



  





 You thrive in a dynamic environment where change drives development and improvement. You’re able to handle complex information, solve problems independently, and communicate clearly both verbally and in writing. You value teamwork, enjoy sharing ideas, and are always eager to learn and grow.
 



  





 At Euro Accident, we believe that our people build our success. That’s why personal qualities and abilities are just as important as experience.
 



  





**Please note: We can only consider applicants who are currently located in Sweden, legally authorized to work in Sweden, and meet one of the following criteria:** 



* **Swedish citizenship**
* **EU/EEA citizenship with current residence in Sweden**
* **A valid Swedish work permit**



  





**We offer you** 




 When we contribute to a secure and healthy world, we start in our own offices. We want you to have and choose a healthy balance between work and private life, and we cherish the joy of work and our unique culture where care, initiative, and innovation are our guiding principles in everyday life. In addition to favorable occupational pension and flexible working hours, our comprehensive benefits package includes, among other things, health and medical insurance, counseling support, a generous wellness grant, opportunities for exercise and massage during working hours, and a communal breakfast every day, as well as other social activities in true EA spirit!
 



  





 You'll be welcomed to our office at Mörby C. Start date by agreement. This is a permanent full-time position, with a six-month probationary period.
 



  





**Welcome with your application** 




 If you have any questions about the position, you're welcome to contact hiring manager Mudasir Khan using the contact details below.
 **Selection is ongoing, and the position may be filled before the final application date, so don’t wait to apply!** 




  





 For a fair and objective selection process, we use psychometric tests early in the recruitment processes and ask you to answer selection questions instead of attaching a personal letter.
 



  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates before making a hiring decision.
 



  





*Please note that we do not accept applications via email due to GDPR.pr*

title: SEB Trainee Programme 2026-27: Non-Financial Risk Manager | SEB, Stockholm

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 The application period for the International Trainee programme is open until 11th January 2026 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact career@seb.se, but we will not process applications via e-mail.
   

  

 The International Trainee programme will start on 1st September 2026.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We want to get to know you, and for you to get to know us.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Includes**
* Psychometric tests
* Interviews – digitally and/or on-site
* A case exercise and presentation
* SEB Day – an event to learn more about SEB and the programme, with insights from former trainees


 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Find out more about the International Trainee Programme here: International Trainee Programme | SEB
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: IT Helpdesk-tekniker till AXIS Communications
description:
Är du en serviceinriktad IT-tekniker som vill vara med och bygga upp IT-stödet på ett växande kontor? AXIS Communications söker dig som trivs i en global miljö och gillar att lösa problem.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Det här är en roll där du får vara med och bygga upp den lokala IT-supporten på plats, samtidigt som du blir en del av ett etablerat och välfungerande IT Helpdesk-team med kollegor i Lund och Linköping. I teamet är det en hjälpsam och prestigelösa kultur, här arbetar man tillsammans för att leverera service i toppklass.
 



 IT Helpdesk-teamet består av cirka 40 medarbetare uppdelade i sex funktionella team:
 



 • Windows-klienter
 



 • Linux-klienter
 



 • Mac-klienter
 



 • Telefoner
 



 • Konferensrum
 



 • Interna system och access management
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som IT-tekniker på AXIS i Stockholm blir du den lokala kontaktpersonen för kollegorna på kontoret och säkerställer att de har fungerande IT-lösningar i sitt dagliga arbete. Du kommer att ge support både på plats och på distans till användare i Sverige och internationellt.
 



 Du kommer bland annat att:
 


* Ge intern IT-support till medarbetare i Stockholm och fjärrsupport globalt
* Supportera Linux-, Windows- och Mac-klienter
* Underhålla och supportera konferensrum och utrustning
* Installera, konfigurera och leverera datorer
* Felsöka hård- och mjukvara
* Utföra administrativa uppgifter i AD/Azure/Entra/Intune
* Arbeta via ärendehanteringssystem, telefon, fjärranslutning och på plats
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation



  





**Du erbjuds** 



* En roll i ett världsledande teknikföretag med innovation i fokus
* Möjlighet att forma IT-stödet på Stockholmskontoret
* Ett varmt och socialt kontor med frukostar, fika och stark gemenskap
* Ett omfattande onboardingprogram och mentorstöd



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har minst ett års erfarenhet av IT-support
* Har goda kunskaper i antingen Windows, Linux eller Mac med stort intresse för att lära sig alla tre
* Har erfarenhet av konferensrumssupport
* Har arbetat i ärendehanteringssystem (t.ex. ServiceNow)
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande, i både tal och skrift



  





 Vi söker dig som är en serviceinriktad och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med eget ansvar men också uppskattar samarbetet med kollegor i ett större team. Din nyfikenhet och prestigelöshet gör att du passar perfekt in i AXIS välkomnande och samarbetsdrivna kultur.
 



  





**Om AXIS Communications** 




 AXIS Communications är en global ledare inom nätverksbaserade lösningar för videoövervakning, ljud, åtkomstkontroll och smarta säkerhetssystem. Företaget grundades 1984 och har sitt huvudkontor i Lund, med över 5 000 medarbetare i mer än 50 länder. AXIS drivs av en tydlig vision, att skapa en smartare och säkrare värld genom innovativ teknik.
 



  





**Övrigt** 




**Start** 
 : Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse
 



**Plats** 
 : Stockholm men rollen inkluderar resor till Linköping och Lund.
 



**Anställningsform** 
 : Detta är ett konsultuppdrag som sträcker sig över 12 månader följt av en direktanställning hos kund.
 



  





 Rekryteringen sköts av A-hub i nära samarbete med AXIS Communications. Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

title: Technical Program Manager, Google Meet Foundation
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in program or project management.
* Experience in delivering technical programs.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* 5 years of experience managing cross-functional or cross-team projects.
* Experience working with globally distributed teams.
* Ability to adapt to changing environments.
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.


**About The Job**
 A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.
   

  

 It's our job to help inform and educate users, advertisers, partners, opinion leaders--and our own employees--about the benefits of Google's products, our distinctive company culture/values, and our approach to the big public policy issues of the day. To succeed here, you'll combine creativity with organizational skills to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines simultaneously, as well as enjoy pitching to journalists, bloggers and commentators, or producing internal communications and events for our employees. Things happen quickly at Google and to get stuff done here you need to be an enthusiastic team player who can work cross-functionally and isn't hesitant to take risks or try new things.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead cross-functional, high priority programs from inception to launch, managing dependencies and risks across multiple sub-projects.
* Define and refine technical requirements, scope, and success metrics for projects.
* Drive process improvements and efficiencies within and across teams to enhance productivity and scalability.
* Communicate program status, challenges, and solutions effectively to all stakeholders, including executive leadership.
* Facilitate regular planning exercises and help drive process improvements.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Founding AI Engineer
description:
If you have experience building and scaling multi-agentic systems, we would love to speak with you. We just raised from Lightspeed and are currently building out a world-class team.
 



  





 At Epiminds, we’re building a self-learning marketing team of 20+ autonomous agents working across data, creative, strategy, and execution — all led by Lucy, a super-agent who collaborates with human marketers like a real teammate: reaching out, listening, emailing, and even calling.
 



  





 Today, 17 agencies and 270 brands leverage our product to save 60 % of their time. We just raised a $6m round from Lightspeed to meet high demand from our users. Lightspeed has also invested in Anthropic, xAI, Mistral, and other decacorns.
 



  





 Right now, we are focused on continuously improving Lucy and her team. While also closing more deals with customers.
 



  





 Your role as a founding AI engineer will be to build on the multi-agentic system that powers Lucy today.
 



  





 Here’s some tasks that you will work on:
 


* Creating new specialist agents
* Improving our proprietary agentic framework
* Train models on top of proprietary data set with terabytes of data
* Continuing to improve collaboration, memory and other critical parts of the system



  





 What we’re looking for
 


* You have experience building out multi-agentic systems
* You have deep knowledge and experience of building ML/AI system beyond calling an API
* You are prepared to put in the work required for building a category defining product



  





 Why Epiminds
 


* We’re transforming manual marketing into an intelligent, self-evolving system. The next era won’t rely on manual execution, it will be orchestrated by autonomous AI teams that learn, create, and strategize with superhuman precision, speed, and imagination.
* We’re a small, high-ownership team from Spotify, Google, and Kry, backed by investors behind Anthropic, xAI and Mistral. We’re here to change the world-not someday, but now. The systems we build will redefine how ideas are created, how decisions are made, and how marketing itself evolves. If you want to help rewrite that future, this is where it begins.

title: Shift Supervisor
description:
**Your mission at Voi** 




 As a Shift Supervisor you will be responsible for a team of Fleet Specialists in Stockholm, overseeing operations while at the same time support them in their daily work. You will spend the majority of your time performing tasks in the warehouse and In field together with the team and the rest of the time for managerial duties such as planning, performance follow up, administrative tasks etc.
 



 Your responsibilities will include:
 


* **Vehicle Utilization** 
  – You are out on the streets, collecting and deploying our scooters with a hands on mentality
* **Navigating Logistics** 
  – Aid in receiving, packing, and deploying new vehicles
* **Managing your team –** 
 Assist in creating shift plans, cultivate team performance and supervise your team's activities, ensuring tasks are conducted efficiently and safely
* **Upholding Quality Standards** 
  – Collaborate with your team to identify and rectify damaged or misplaced vehicles, ensuring tidy parking spots and restoring fallen vehicles
* **Synergistic Planning** 
  – Collaborate with managers to optimise work schedules, ensuring efficient shift planning and execution.



**What you need to embark:** 




 We are looking for a Supervisor with a hands-on mentality who is not afraid to roll up the sleeves and get the job done. Key qualifications include:
   




* A valid driver's license for Sweden
* Previous leadership experience
* Fluency in English, fostering clear communication. Knowledge of Swedish is desirable
* A proactive, positive attitude and a strong sense of ownership.
* Skilled in promoting and nurturing team collaboration



**Job conditions:** 



* **Contract:** 
 Fixed term
* **Working hours:** 
 Part time (60%)
* **Start date:** 
 As agreed upon



**Why Voi?** 




 Working at Voi is more than just a job; it's a personal Voiage where you'll grow as a professional and be part of a diverse team and culture that's committed to making a positive impact on society. In addition to this, you'll have the opportunity to
 **:**



* Join Europe's leading micromobility company and one of the fastest-growing scale-ups
* Make a direct impact on our ongoing success and contribute to the development of the micromobility industry in Sweden.
* Collaborate with inspiring, motivated, and diverse colleagues who share a common goal
* Be a part of the micromobility revolution and help create sustainable cities that are clean, quiet, and free from pollution



**Are you ready to join the Voiage?**

title: IT-säkerhetsspecialister
description:
Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med den senaste tekniken ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker nu två IT-säkerhetsspecialister som ska förstärka vårt arbete med att förbättra IT-säkerheten. Du kommer att hjälpa till både i våra projekt, våra driftsatta system samt inför olika förändringar. Du kommer även att samverka med olika delar av vår verksamhet för att stärka IT-säkerheten.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär att:
   

  

* Driva IT-säkerhetsarbete inom projekt och/eller förvaltning medett tydligt ansvar mot projektledning och förvaltningsledning.
* Leda och genomföra hotmodelleringar.
* Säkerställa krav och regelefterlevnad inför revisoner, granskningar och samråd.
* Bidra med teknisk kompetens i syfte att höja säkerheten.


 Du får möjlighet att utveckla ditt tekniska kunnande i en expansiv fas med många utmaningar inom så väl IT som OT. Du får även möjlighet att utvecklas inom ditt kompetensområde genom ett stort kontaktnät på Svenska kraftnät och kommer att kunna utbyta erfarenheter med kollegor som arbetat länge i branschen.
   

  

 Som IT-säkerhetsspecialist på enheten ISS IT-Säkerhetsstöd kommer du att vara en del av ett team med seniora kollegor. Du kommer arbeta med olika projekt/ förvaltningar med syfte att höja IT-säkerheten. I ditt arbete ingår att ha många kontaktytor, förstå vilka utmaningar projekten och förvaltningarna står inför och att bidra till att lösa dessa på bästa sätt.
   

  

**Om dig**
**Skallkrav:**
 Då du kommer att komma i kontakt med ett flertal projekt och förvaltningar så krävs det att du är vetgirig och relationsskapande. Arbetets karaktär gör att det även är nödvändigt att du är strukturerad och stabil.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare har du en relevant högskoleexamen, inom områden som t.ex. teknik, el, IT/data eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt som Svenska kraftnät bedömer som likvärdig.
   

  

 Du har även:
   

  

* minst 3 års erfarenhet av IT-säkerhetsrelaterat arbete, gärna inom en bransch som omfattas av säkerhetsskyddskrav
* kunskap om datanätverk
* god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska i tal och skrift
* god förmåga att kommunicera på engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är
 **meriterande** 
 om du har kunskap och erfarenhet:
   

  

* inom SCADA system
* inom OT nära infrastruktur
* av att identifiera och driva egna initiativ och
* har relevanta IT-säkerhetscertifikat så som t.ex. (CISSP/ISC2)


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm/Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Resor kan förekomma i denna tjänst.
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 9 november 2025. Vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev. Vänligen bifoga ditt CV på svenska som tydligt beskriver den erfarenhet som vi söker.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


 Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Robin Björkén 010 475 83 63, vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Anna Maria Hedman 010 489 26 71, Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Erica Midfjäll ST, 010 475 87 31. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

 Jobba här – bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Digital Marketing Intern
description:
We are now seeking a full-time
 **Digital Marketing Intern** 
 from January 2026 for a minimum of 6 months to join our EMEA Marketing Team at BabyBjörn HQ in Stockholm.
 



  





 As a Digital Marketing Intern, you will gain hands-on experience in key aspects of performance-driven digital marketing-helping accelerate our brand's growth across paid social channels, affiliate networks, and SEM, while sharpening your analytical skills.
 



  





 Reporting directly to the Performance Specialist and being a member of the EMEA marketing team, you will be immersed in digital campaign strategy, execution, analysis, and optimization.
 



  





**What you will be doing in your role:** 



* Assist in managing, optimising, and expanding our affiliate marketing programs, identifying new partner opportunities, onboarding affiliates, and maintaining strong relationships with existing partners.
* Contribute to the planning, execution, and optimisation of paid social media campaigns (primarily META), including audience targeting, creative testing, budget allocation, and performance analysis.
* Support the management of SEM campaigns, including keyword selection, ad copy creation, performance monitoring, and reporting.
* Participate in ongoing A/B testing and experimentation across channels to identify growth drivers, improve conversion rates, and optimise ROAS.
* Assist in preparing detailed reports to track KPIs, share campaign insights, and present analyses for internal and external stakeholders.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams on marketing initiatives and participate in regional team meetings.



  





 You will also have the opportunity to support other key EMEA marketing areas throughout this 6 month period.
 



  





**What skills will help you be successful:** 



* You’re currently pursuing a degree in digital marketing.
* Familiarity with marketing principles and an interest in customer acquisition and digital advertising
* Previous work experience in growth-related marketing or business development is preferred
* Must be a positive and outgoing person with an entrepreneurial mindset
* Strong team player with an interest in learning new things
* Fluent in English, with additional languages being a plus



  





**The internship MUST be part of your education/university program as it is unpaid and based from the Stockholm office.** 




  





 In your application, we want you to include:
 


* What are you studying, and what is the purpose of your internship?
* Whether the internship is connected to a school project?
* Why you want to intern with us?



  





 As EMEA Digital Marketing Intern, you will be reporting to the EMEA Performance Specialist and you will be based at the BabyBjörn HQ in Stockholm (Sundbyberg), Sweden.
 



  





 We are accepting applications for this position until November 30th, 2025, but we will start interviewing applicants before that time.
 



  





**We look forward to reviewing your application!** 




  





*BabyBjörn AB is a Swedish, family-owned company that has around 200 employees within its Groups and develops, markets, and distributes children´s products, primarily for the age group 0-3 years. The company was founded in 1961, and since then more than 50 million children have been carried in our baby carriers. We have a turnover today of more than SEK 1 billion, and 95% of our sales are exports to more than fifty countries. As we exist for all types of families, no matter their structure, lifestyle, or identity, we strive for this to be reflected in our organization as well.* 




*More information is available at www.babybjorn.com* 




  





*Important information when submitting an application to BabyBjörn AB:* 




*By submitting an application, you consent to BabyBjörn AB storing and potentially using your personal data for recruitment purposes for a period of 24 months following the date on which the data was obtained. Your personal data will not be processed for any purpose other than that previously stated, and your data will not be transferred to a third party. For more information about where and for how long we process your personal data, as well as more information about your rights regarding erasure and data portability, please contact us at mydata@babybjorn.com.*

title: Testledare/Testare
description:
Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med den senaste tekniken ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Nu söker vi två erfarna
 **testledare/testare** 
 till förvaltningsobjekten inom balansering och elmarknad. Förvaltningsobjekten förvaltar och utvecklar IT-lösningar för komplexa systemintegrationer, där IT-testledning spelar en viktig roll för ett stabilt kraftnät.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för hela testkedjan – från idé och planering till genomförande, dokumentation och uppföljning – i samverkan med projektledare, systemansvariga, verksamhetsspecialister och utvecklingsteam. I tjänsten ingår även att
   

  

* Ansvara för planering, ledning och uppföljning av testarbete
* Ta fram och förvalta teststrategier, testplaner och testfall
* Säkerställa testbarhet i kravspecifikationer och granska krav
* Utföra system-, integrations- och acceptanstester, samt regressionstester
* Koordinera testarbete mellan projekt, team, leverantörer och nordiska operatörer
* Rapportera status, risker och avvikelser till förvaltnings- och projektledning
* Hantera felrapportering och kvalitetssäkring
* Bidra till ett kvalitetsfokuserat arbetssätt i tvärfunktionella team


 Som testledare/testare tillhör du enheten Elmarknadsapplikationer som förvaltar och utvecklar applikationer från bud till avräkning på elmarknaden. Du kommer även att arbeta nära övriga enheter och sektioner inom avdelningen IT för Kraftsystem & Elmarknad.
   

  

**Om dig**
**Skallkrav**
 Vi söker dig som är
   

  

* Analytisk och lösningsorienterad
* Resultatdriven och strukturerad
* En stark lagspelare
* Kreativ med god kommunikationsförmåga


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare har du en eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande relevant arbetslivserfarenhet. Du har även
   

  

* Minst 7 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom testning och testledning
* Erfarenhet av testning i komplexa system inom säkerhetskänsliga eller samhällskritiska miljöer (t.ex. offentlig sektor, elförsörjning, bank/finans eller läkemedel)
* God erfarenhet av både funktionell och icke-funktionell testning
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


 Det är
 **meriterande** 
 om du har
   

  

* Bakgrund inom branscher som elförsörjning, offentlig sektor, telekom, bank/finans eller läkemedel
* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering och verktyg som Azure DevOps, JIRA, TM4J eller motsvarande
* Certifieringar inom test (t.ex. ISTQB Foundation/Advanced) eller kravanalys (IREB CPRE)
* Erfarenhet av programmeringsspråk såsom Python, SQL/PLSQL, XML, PHP, HTML, xHTML, Java m fl.
* Erfarenhet av internationella projekt där samordning över landsgränser ingått
* Erfarenhet som Scrum master och arbetat i tvärfunktionella, agila team enligt Scrum eller Kanban


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsterna är placerade i Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Resor förekommer i enstaka fall, både nationellt och internationellt
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 10 november 2025. Du kommer att få svara på ett antal frågor istället för ett personligt brev, därför behöver du bara bifoga ditt CV
* Vi kommer göra urval för intervju under pågående annonseringstid
* Tjänsterna är tillsvidareanställningar
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


**Vid frågor, kontakta gärna**
* Jessica Ternander, rekryterande chef, 010 489 26 17
* Victoria Waltenberg, rekryterare, 010 350 90 45
* Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72
* Erica Midfjäll, ST, 010 475 87 31


 Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se.
   

  

 Jobba här – bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
A leader in Engineering and IT Services, ALTEN has nearly 60,000 employees, 88% of whom are engineers. Present in more than 30 countries, the Group supports its clients' development strategies in the areas of innovation, R&D, and information technology systems.
 



  





**We are looking for Embedded Software Engineers to join our team in Sweden.** 




  





 You will be part of strategic technology transfers and platform integrations for national defense operations.
 



 As a VIE at ALTEN, you'll have the opportunity to work on challenging and exciting projects with some of our key clients, with:
 


* Technical challenges and development opportunities.
* An inspiring community and the chance to contribute to a sustainable future.
* Supportive and coaching leadership.
* The possibility to work across various industries where our clients operate.







**For this opportunity, we are looking for an ambitious professional eager to work in a multicultural and collaborative environment, with the following qualifications:** 



* M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Engineering Physics, Computer Science, Mechatronics, Robotics, or similar.
* You have a first experience as an Embedded Software Engineer.
* Knowledge of C++/C.
* Experience with Python is a plus.



  





**ALTEN’s Commitment** 




**Our three pillars of sustainability commitment:** 



* **People:** 
 We celebrate the richness of our employees’ diversity, representing over 100 nationalities. Our commitment is to foster an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and contribute meaningfully. We support skill development and actively encourage personal and professional growth.
* **Environment:** 
 Our mission is to minimize our environmental impact while promoting sustainable growth. We are committed to achieving
 **net zero emissions by 2050** 
 , a goal that guides our operations and strategic initiatives.
* **Sustainable Innovation:** 
 At ALTEN, we view sustainability challenges as opportunities to drive research and innovation. With
 **31% of our internal R&D focused on sustainable innovation** 
 , we are determined to turn these challenges into solutions that create value and drive progress.

title: Field Software Support Specialist
description:
At
 **Elekta** 
 , we are united by a clear purpose:
 **to improve, prolong and save lives** 
 . Our advanced oncology and radiotherapy software solutions are used globally to treat cancer and brain disorders. Now, we’re looking for a
 **Field Software Support Specialist** 
 to join our high-performing team – someone who thrives in dynamic environments and is passionate about supporting technology that truly matters.
   

  

 As a
 **Field Software Support Specialist** 
 , you will serve as the central point of contact for service-related matters concerning Elekta software and third-party integrations within your region. You’ll manage and resolve technical issues in complex clinical IT environments, deliver first-level training, and ensure outstanding customer satisfaction through proactive and responsive support.
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
* Act as the primary contact for customers on all service-related software issues.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues in Windows Server and SQL-based environments (remote & on-site)
* Proactively monitor systems and perform preventative support.
* Handle technical inquiries via phone and manage prioritization and planning of service tasks.
* Document incidents, actions, and resolutions per Elekta and local compliance standards.
* Communicate clearly with both internal teams and external stakeholders.
* Escalate complex issues and ensure timely resolution
* Provide first-level software training to local hardware service teams.
* Champion customer satisfaction and propose improvements
* Maintain ongoing dialogue with Sales and Service Management regarding customer insights.


**What You Bring**
* Completed studies in a field of information technology or similar engineering sciences.
* Experience with troubleshooting Windows client and server operating systems, virtualization and remote access tools, Citrix, networking configuration, troubleshooting, and Microsoft SQL installation/configuration is essential.
* Experience in medical imaging, linear accelerators and/or clinical use of radiotherapy products is desirable.
* Experience in a support environment is desirable.
* Excellent knowledge of local language and good knowledge of English, both written and spoken.
* Strong analytical skills with an excellent feel for dynamically changing situations and priorities.
* Interest and curiosity in acquiring knowledge independently.
* Strong communication skills and enjoy interacting with people.
* High degree of self-organization, ability to work in a team and personal responsibility
* Exceptional self-motivation and flexibility.
* Able to travel up to 20% in the assigned territory.


**We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement—your unique skills and experiences might be exactly what we're looking for!**
**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop.
   

  

**Hiring process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact**
 For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Nidhi Pousette, nidhi.pousette@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are a MedTech company that provides software and hardware to hospitals and clinics all over the world.
   

  

 We have a responsibility toward our partners and customers to deliver solutions in a secure and sustainable way. Both when it comes to financial and environmental matters, but also for our employees to feel that they bring value, wherever in the organization they may work

title: Graphic Designer to H&M HOME
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M Home is a design driven interior brand with a purpose to make interior dreams possible for many. The collections merge modern design and quality with affordable prices where creating value for money products are key. Keeping a high design level is important for us. With us, you get the opportunity to work close to our customers in a collaborative, creative and dynamic culture.  We challenge you with big responsibility from the start, and we take care of each other by sharing ideas and knowledge. With our entrepreneurial mindset, we inspire and attract customers all over the world.
   

  

**We are now looking for an experienced and ambitious Graphic Designer with an impeccable taste and a strong eye for commercial design to join our Interior Design team and help shape the future of H&M HOME.**
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As Graphic Designer at H&M HOME, you will take ownership of our graphic expression across products, focusing on typography and packaging design. You’ll work closely with Product and Print Designers and collaborate across multiple product teams to ensure every graphic element is consistent, commercial and aligned with our brand identity.
   

  

 Your responsibilities include…
   

  

* Designing inspiring and commercial graphics based on customer insights, trends and competitor analysis
* Leading the development of product packaging and graphic elements, ensuring alignment with print techniques and product purpose
* Creating strong typographic concepts and coordinating visual elements into cohesive designs
* Reviewing samples and prototypes, refining artwork to meet quality and design standards
* Collaborating across teams to set timelines that support a creative and efficient design process
* Staying informed about selling insights and using them to guide future graphic direction


**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
 You’re a creative thinker with a strong sense of style and a passion for interior design. You understand our customer and know how to translate insights into graphic concepts that are both inspiring and commercial. You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and take ownership of your work.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone with…
   

  

* A degree in graphic design (BA or MA), or equivalent experience
* 3+ years’ experience working with graphic design in an interior, design-/brand agency or fashion context
* Strong expertise in typography and packaging design
* Proficiency in Adobe Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)
* Knowledge of print and manufacturing techniques
* Experience from global markets and understanding of diverse customer groups is highly valued


 And someone who is…
   

  

* Customer-focused, with a clear understanding of our target audience
* Skilled in building graphic concepts and coordinating visual elements
* Structured and collaborative, with excellent communication skills
* Self-driven, with a proactive mindset and a desire to improve ways of working


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, and ARKET)
* H&M Incentive Program - HIP. Learn more about the program here.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things - our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 This is a
 **full-time permanent position** 
 based in our Stockholm office.
 **Apply by sending in your CV and Portfolio in English as soon as possible.** 
 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Supply Chain Coordinator
description:
**SUPPLY CHAIN COORDINATOR** 





 Stockholm
 










 Employment Type: Fixed-term parental leave cover (February 2026 - approximately February 2027, with possible extension)
 





 Reports to: Head of Operations
 





 Status: Full-Time, starting February 2026 until approximately February 2027
 









**Job Description** 





 The position is based in our head office located in the heart of Södermalm in Stockholm.
 




  






 ATP Atelier is looking for a Supply Chain Coordinator to join our team on a fixed-term parental-leave cover. If you have a strong analytical and highly action-oriented profile, constantly seek new growth opportunities, and enjoy working in a fast-paced international environment, there’s an opportunity for you to join us on our exciting journey. In this role, you will coordinate our supply chain and logistical operations between key suppliers and customers, ensuring an efficient and seamless process from production in Italy to customers worldwide - from London to New York.
 




  






 Emerging technologies are transforming the way the supply chain operates. Our ideal candidate is passionate about utilizing technology to enhance productivity and efficiency, while maintaining operational excellence and identifying new growth opportunities. The role requires a business-minded individual with strong attention to detail, and a deep understanding and passion for supply chain dynamics.
 





  
 




**Tasks & Responsibilities** 



* Execute advanced planning, monitoring, and processing of in/outbound orders to align with sales periods.
* Maintain high delivery quality, align logistics with policies, and ensure customer service excellence.
* Collaborate with 3PL partners, couriers, and key partners to ensure operational excellence.
* Use and improve supply chain systems and Excel templates for efficiency.
* Maintain and optimize department-specific processes.
* Work cross-functionally with Finance, Marketing, and Commercial teams on supply-chain topics and product launches.
* Ensure departmental objectives align with business strategy.
* Assist with supply-chain development projects and continuous improvements.
* Handle ad-hoc tasks as needed.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply-Chain/Logistics, Engineering, or similar.
* Minimum 3 years of experience in Supply-Chain/Logistics.
* Strong business sense, numerical/analytical skills, and problem-solving abilities.
* Action-oriented with hands-on approach and ability to translate ideas into actions.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Proficient in MS Office, especially Excel; experience with ERP/order management systems.
* Ability to suggest improvements for accuracy, efficiency, and cost reduction.
* Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask.
* Value simplicity and impact over complexity and prestige.
* Fluency in English; additional languages are a plus.



  





**About us**
