title: Salesforce lösnings- och applikationsarkitekt
description:
Som Salesforce lösnings- och applikationsarkitekt på Addcent både formar och driver du implementationen av lösningar som utvecklar kundupplevelsen och företagens digitala kunddialog. Tillsammans med ditt kunniga Addcent-team skapar du effektiva, användbara, genomtänkta och långsiktigt hållbara lösningar som passar in i våra kunders systemlandskap.
**VAD INNEBÄR TJÄNSTEN?**
-------------------------


Som expert på Salesforce-lösningar kommer du att få möjlighet att delta i förstudier som tar fram roadmaps samt spela en nyckelroll i Salesforce-implementationer och förbättringsprojekt. Du gör det på lösnings- och applikationsnivå samt i nära samspel med våra verksamhetsutvecklare och utvecklare. Vi har lång erfarenhet av implementationer på Salesforce, här du därför möjlighet att på ett snabbt och effektivt sätt skapa användbara lösningar som dessutom är skalbara och kan möta upp ett växande behov.

**Driva både implementationer och förbättringsprojekt****VEM ÄR DU?**
--------------


Du är en driven konsult med erfarenhet av att designa och implementera Salesforce-lösningar. Du har ett pragmatiskt och affärsmässigt synsätt på lösningar och har förmågan att tekniskt leda Salesforce-initiativ som snabbt resulterar i affärsvärde för våra uppdragsgivare. Du ansvarar för lösnings- och funktionell design som omsätter kundernas behov i en fungerande Salesforce-lösning, datamodellerar och implementerar nyckelfunktionalitet på konfigurations/low code-nivå samt definierar uppgifter för utvecklare och testare. Du designar dataflöden och integrationer med andra system och säkerställer att uvecklare implementerar dessa på ett sätt som motsvarar behoven.

### **Kvalifikationer**


* Konsulterfarenhet
* Bakgrund som applikationskonsult eller utvecklare och systemarkitekt
* Relevanta Salesforce-certifieringarMinst 8 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom Sales och Service på Salesforce core-plattform
* Erfarenhet av konfiguration/low-code implementation på Salesforce core-plattform från implementationsprojekt
* Erfarenhet av teknisk projektledning, alternativt Scrum Master
* Flerårig erfarenhet av ledande roller i implementationsprojekt på Salesforce core-plattform
* Mycket god förmåga att analysera krav och utforma informationsmodeller
* Mycket god förmåga att designa och dokumentera lösningar utifrån olika perspektiv
* God kommunikationsförmåga utifrån ett lösnings- och verksamhetsperspektiv
* Professionell förmåga att kommunicera i tal och skrift på svenska samt mycket god förmåga på engelska

  



Meriterande:
* Erfarenhet inom och certifieringar för Salesforce CPQ och Field Service
* Erfarenhet av Data Cloud och Agentforce
* Erfarenhet av Marketing Automation och Salesforce Marketing Cloud

  



**Bakgrund som applikationskonsult eller utvecklare och systemarkitekt****VAD ERBJUDER VI?**
--------------------


På Addcent blir du en del av ett proffsigt och trevligt gäng med CX-experter som alla jobbar tillsammans för att lösa komplexa problem åt våra kunder. Som konsult hos oss har du stor frihet i hur du löser ditt uppdrag. Som stöd finns både en djup sammanlagd kunskap hos dina kollegor – och ett strukturkapital som på ett stort konsultbolag. Vi har ett end-to-end erbjudande till våra kunder, vilket ger dig möjlighet att jobba med hela processen – från de tidiga faserna till implementeringen. Du jobbar nära kund under hela resan och ser resultatet av det du gör.  



Vi vill att du ska kunna jobba länge hos oss. Därför ser vi till att du har en jämn och hållbar arbetsbelastning. Utöver att utveckla och fördjupa dig inom din konsultdomän, så får du också vara med och utveckla Addcent inom det område som intresserar dig. Vår verksamhet präglas av en entreprenörsanda och ett starkt driv, och vi vet att det både blir bättre – och roligare – att växa tillsammans.

**Vi vill att du ska kunna jobba länge hos oss. Därför ser vi till att du har en jämn och hållbar arbetsbelastning.****ÄR DU INTRESSERAD?**
----------------------


Vi rekryterar löpande, uppfyller du kraven för tjänsten så är du välkommen att höra av dig till oss genom att klicka på ”Bli kontaktad” eller skicka ett mejl till career@addcent.com.

**VI ÄR ADDCENT**
-----------------


Addcent är ett management- och IT-konsultföretag som hjälper företag att digitalisera sina kundinteraktioner. Vi driver förändring genom att utgå från våra kunders affärsmål och gör en genomlysning av verksamheten, IT och data. Vi utvecklar processer och arbetssätt, och designar sedan bästa möjliga IT-stöd. Hos oss jobbar management-konsulter, verksamhetsanalytiker, lösningsarkitekter och applikationsnära experter tillsammans i uppdragen. Vi har djup kunskap inom CX-området, kombinerat med en stark drivkraft att lösa komplexa problem – och designa den bästa möjliga upplevelsen åt våra kunders kunder. Läs mer på addcent.se

title: Product Owner Data & Analytics (vikariat) - Apotek Hjärtat
description:
Om jobbet som Product Owner på Hjärtat
  
Apotek Hjärtat befinner sig mitt i en omfattande datatransformation där vi bygger upp nya agila arbetssätt, verktyg och strukturer för att ta tillvara på kraften i data. Som Product Owner inom Data& Analytics har du en nyckelroll i att driva produktområdet framåt och skapa största möjliga affärsvärde. Du ansvarar för backloggen, prioriterar utvecklingsinsatser och följer upp leveranser. Rollen handlar om att skapa samarbete, främja datadrivna arbetssätt och stötta teamet i rätt riktning.
  
  

Tjänsten är ett vikariat med planerad start i februari och sträcker sig över ett år.
  
  

Dina ansvarsområden
  
  

* Bygga starka relationer med stakeholders och hantera deras behov
* Samarbeta med D Domain Lead samt AI& Transformation Lead för strategisk riktning
* Äga, koordinera och prioritera utvecklingsteamens backlog
* Säkerställa att utvecklingsprinciper följs och ta ansvar för hela livscykeln för data- och analysprodukterna
* Coacha och vägleda teammedlemmar inom Data& Analytics


Är du den vi söker?
  
Du är en trygg och analytisk ledare med god kommunikativ förmåga och ett tydligt fokus på att skapa affärsvärde. Du har erfarenhet av att driva utveckling i komplexa miljöer och trivs med att ta initiativ, strukturera arbetet och leda team mot gemensamma mål. Du har förmågan att omsätta affärsbehov till konkreta leveranser och är van att navigera i förändring.
  
  

För att lyckas i rollen bör du ha
  
  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom teknik, ekonomi, statistik eller motsvarande
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsteam inom data och analys – exempelvis som Product Owner, Projektledare eller Funktionsledare
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Giltigt arbetstillstånd i Sverige eller EU-medborgarskap


Det är ett plus om du har
  
  

* Tidigare erfarenhet som utvecklare inom data och analys
* Erfarenhet av cloud, gärna Azure eller GCP


Din ansökan
  
Tjänsten är ett vikariat på heltid med placering i Solna och arbete i hybridform. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-11-17. Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Om rollen kräver det kan arbetspsykologiska tester och bakgrundskontroller förekomma. All extern hjälp med rekrytering undanbedes.
  
  

Har du frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Karl Berthén, Manager Data& Analytics, på karl.berthen@apotekhjartat.se. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Klara Himmelstrand på klara.himmelstrand@ica.se.

title: Telecom network tester
description:
Steadfast is looking for Telecom network (4G/5G) test engineer to work & learn in a fast paced Telecom environment. Prime responsibility in this role includes test case creation & test execution for telecom network & telecom solutions. In addition, ready to perform operations, troubleshooting & support activities when required.
  
  

Competence requirements
  
  

**Technical skills:**  

* Sound knowledge on Telecom technologies – Core network (4G, 5G SA), Voice, IMS, Messaging, Roaming.
* Good understanding in IP networking, TCP/IP protocol stack, DNS, VPN/IPsec, MPLS.
* Knowledge & experience in Linux & Cloud/virtualization technologies.
* Able to analyse and troubleshoot complex network & system issues.
* Knowledge about API integrations.
* Should be able to work in support & operations and do troubleshooting when required.
* Understanding of IoT, eSIM, BSS & OSS solutions.
* Familiarity with IT infrastructure & Network Security will be an added advantage.


**Soft skills:**  

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to explain complex technical findings clearly.
* Strong analytical mindset and structured approach to problem-solving.
* Collaborative, customer-focused, and comfortable working with international stakeholders.
* Proactive, detail-oriented, and committed to quality and timely delivery.
* Action oriented & positive mindset.
* Ready to learn new technologies & products when required.


**Start:** January, 2026
  
**Location:** Onsite - Stockholm, Sweden

title: Commercial Product Manager
description:
* Application Deadline: Nov. 23, 2025
* Kista
* Hybrid
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

*Step into a key role with business responsibility enabling how businesses procure and maximizing business values out of their mobile devices, products, and value-added services. As Commercial Product Manager you’ll turn customer needs into offers that deliver real value, working across teams to secure growth, efficiency, and impact.*



At Tele2 B2B (Business to business), we work every day to enable a society of unlimited possibilities through our broad portfolio of IT- and Telecom related Products and Services. With a team of knowledgeable experts, we help Private and Public customers to digitalize and secure their business potential. We are now looking for a new member to join our successful team and contribute to our growth, superior customer experience and high employee engagement.

  

**About the job**  

The product area focus is to delivers mobile phones, accessories, and other workplace-supporting hardware to meet customer needs and create added value. The team is responsible for developing and maintaining one of Sweden’s most competitive and cost-efficient product portfolios. We set the product strategy, roadmap and priorities all to ensure profitability, customer relevance, and long-term growth.


* P&L ownership: manage profitability, budget, forecasting, and follow-up for your portfolio.
* Product portfolio management: own, develop, and optimize the portfolio to ensure competitiveness and relevance.
* Commercial strategy & roadmap: design and execute the product strategy, ensuring clear priorities and long-term growth.
* Market and technology insight: stay at the forefront of trends to drive innovation in products, business models, and propositions.
* Customer-centric development: lead initiatives aligned with customer needs.
* Business steering: define agreements, business rules, partnerships, and frameworks to secure performance and scalability.
* Collaboration & delivery: work closely with Supply chain, Device, DCT, customer operations and Sales to ensure product delivery.


**Who are you?**  

To thrive and succeed in this role we believe that you have...


* Strong commercial mindset with P&L ownership and sharp business acumen.
* Ability to turn ideas into successful products and drive innovation.
* Excellent communicator and team player with strong stakeholder management skills.
* Your ability to drive results spans both strategic and hands-on operational activities.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, both written and spoken, is essential.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 is a must



Preferred Qualifications


* Experience within IT and Telco sectors and familiarity with various product areas is a valued asset, although not mandatory.
* Ability to compile presentations for diverse set of stakeholders and higher management teams



We believe that you are an individual with strong ambition to make a change. You are probably a forward thinker updated on the latest trends and market needs. In addition, you are a team player, business savvy and detailed oriented, all complemented with a drive to change the status quo and improve on past performances. You can present and communicate innovative ideas and complex matters in a way all types of stakeholders understand.


**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

* Pension and health care
* Hybrid and flexible work life balance
* Career opportunities
* Parental benefit
* Employee benefits and Tele2 discounts
* Inclusive workplace
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------

**A few words from the manager**


*My name is Martin Östberg, and I am the manager of Tele2 B2B Business Management & Sales enablement team for Managed IT services including hosting and hybrid cloud services, digital workplace offering as well as handsets and accessories together with our e-commerce offering within B2B.*  

*In my team, we encourage each other to be innovative, proactive and too think outside the box. We are committed to integrating sustainability and customer experience into our business strategies.*  

*I would be thrilled to see you as a new member of our future-oriented team!*

  

**Why Tele2**


* We believe in fostering a creative and flexible work environment. You will be part of a culture where teamwork and inclusion are leading the way forward, a place where you bring your whole self to work as the unique person you are. We are committed to building a company that values diversity in all its forms.
* Every employee is important for the company’s success and you will always have an impact through your work with opportunities for growth and development through internal paths.
At Tele2, we work hard to our commitment to lead in sustainability, which has made us a climate leader in Europe according to Financial Times. Sweden’s most sustainable company and ranked 37th globally by Time Magazine and Statista on their inaugural World’s Most Sustainable Companies list, featuring 500 companies from more than 30 countries. We keep reaching new goals as we are bound to shift to a circular economy.  
* 

**Interest and application**  

Would you like to be a part of the Tele2s value-driven and including culture? Then hit the “apply now” button and let’s find out if we’re a match!


If you have any specific questions regarding the position, please feel free to contact TA specialist: [email protected]



Please note that in compliance with personal data management regulations (GDPR), we are unable to accept CVs via email.


Warmly welcome to submit your application! To ensure an inclusive and fair recruitment process, we focus on your experiences and skills. Therefore, Tele2 has chosen not to consider cover letters. Instead, we kindly ask you to answer the screening questions included in the application form.



As a step in the recruitment process, Tele2 performs a background check on final candidates.


**Work with great people**
--------------------------

Emma
Digital Capabilities & Technology
*"Everyone at Tele2 always aim for the stars in order to create unlimited possibilities."*
Fanny
Systemspecialist Unified Communications
*"The work environment at Tele2 supports both personal and professional development, and there are significant opportunities for further career advancement"*
**About the company**
---------------------

At Tele2 we work hard to fulfill our commitment to lead in sustainability, being named a climate leader in Europe by The Financial Times. Sweden’s most sustainable company and ranked 37th globally by Time Magazine and Statista on their inaugural World’s Most Sustainable Companies list, featuring 500 companies from more than 30 countries. We keep reaching new goals as we are bound to shift to a circular economy, and we help our customers to do this too.


Our Values; Be Brave, Take Action, Make it Simple and Act Cost-efficient.
company_description: We enable the transformation of businesses and the creation of tomorrow’s infrastructure. Connecting people and technology far and wide, as well as right here around us. Simple. Sustainable. Smart.

title: Talent Pool for Future Openings - Enterprise/Strategic Account Executive Sweden
description:
Saviynt's AI-powered identity platform manages and governs human and non-human access to all of an organization's applications, data, and business processes. Customers trust Saviynt to safeguard their digital assets, drive operational efficiency, and reduce compliance costs. Built for the AI age, Saviynt is today helping organizations safely accelerate their deployment and usage of AI. Saviynt is recognized as the leader in identity security, with solutions that protect and empower the world’s leading brands, Fortune 500 companies and government institutions. For more information, please visit 
 

 www.saviynt.com
 

 .
 




  





*We’re always looking for talented professionals. Please note: This is not an immediate opening. This listing is to gather a pool of candidates for future openings. By applying, you are being considered for future roles as they become available. If we find a match for our future hiring needs, we will reach out to you directly. We will keep your information on file and contact you should an opportunity arise.* 




  





  






 Saviynt is looking for a professional, highly motivated and energetic Enterprise Account Executive to drive regional enterprise sales for our disruptive IaaS Cloud Security, Access Governance & Privileged Access Management solutions in Sweden.  The AE will combine good working knowledge of (IaaS & SaaS) Identity, Cloud Security or PAM technology with prospecting and sales skills.  This person is ultimately responsible for the entire enterprise sales cycle within their territory and meeting or exceeding territory quota. Account Executives are the primary interface to Enterprise Prospects and responsible for actively driving and managing day to day prospecting & selling activity in the region.  This activity includes opportunity Discovery, Demo, RFP/RFI, Evaluation & POC stages of the sales process, working in conjunction with SE & Product Management Teams to identify & close new deals.
 





  




**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING** 
* Effectively interact with Field Sales, Cloud Team, and Line of Business decision-makers
* Learn and maintain knowledge of Saviynt’s solutions, focused on Cloud Security, Cloud Access Governance & PAM
* Aggressively identify qualified sales opportunities across all assigned accounts/ territory
* Develop and leverage all lead sources (personal and partner contacts, inbound leads, events, and outbound prospecting) to generate meaningful pipeline
* Maintain disciplined, detailed, and up-to-date records on Lead & Opportunity activity in SFDC to ensure effective lead development, proper team communication, and executive visibility
* Be diligent in timely follow-up and provide quality work products
* Attend and assist with corporate and field sales & marketing events
* Achieve monthly and quarterly revenue objectives



  




**WHAT YOU BRING** 
* Must be located in Sweden with relevant language skills for the region
* 5+ years experience in enterprise Identity, Cloud Security, or PAM Sales
* Possess a knowledge base of Cloud Identity Management, Cloud Privileged Access Management and/or Cloud Security Governance technology
* Solid cybersecurity territory contacts at VP, SVP, CxO levels
* Successful history of working with Resellers, SI’s, and Advisories
* Strong Customer Service orientation, persistence, and ability to follow through
* Proven ability and skill to navigate through all levels of an enterprise organization to drive sales
* Professional, ambitious, determined, and results-oriented mindset
* Positive attitude, team-oriented, self-starter who can work alone and in a collaborative manner to achieve regional goals






  




  


**If required for this role, you will:** 




 - Complete security & privacy literacy and awareness training during onboarding and annually thereafter
 



 - Review (initially and annually thereafter), understand, and adhere to Information Security/Privacy Policies and Procedures such as (but not limited to):
 



  





 > Data Classification, Retention & Handling Policy
 



 > Incident Response Policy/Procedures
 



 > Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery Policy/Procedures
 



 > Mobile Device Policy
 



 > Account Management Policy
 



 > Access Control Policy
 



 > Personnel Security Policy
 



 > Privacy Policy
 



  






 Saviynt is an amazing place to work. We are a high-growth, Platform as a Service company focused on Identity Authority to power and protect the world at work. You will experience tremendous growth and learning opportunities through challenging yet rewarding work which directly impacts our customers, all within a welcoming and positive work environment. If you're resilient and enjoy working in a dynamic environment you belong with us!
 




  





***Saviynt is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.***

title: Azure Cloud Architect
description:
As a Cloud Architect, you will join our Public Cloud Delivery team to design, implement and sometimes manage innovative Cloud solutions in Azure for Orange Business's customers.
 



  





 You’ll drive cloud transformation initiatives ranging from enterprise-wide migrations to building governance frameworks and landing zones for our customers.
 



  





 The projects can vary from planning strategic cloud adoption, designing scalable Azure solutions, implementing security and governance frameworks, optimizing costs, and much more. You will work with various enterprise customers, each with unique business challenges and technical requirements.
 



  





 The Cloud Architect is expected to think outside the box, focusing on creating tangible business value through innovative cloud solutions.
 



  





 In the role you will take part in pre-sales and customer meetings/workshops where you'll need to understand each customer's unique challenges and objectives, translate complex technical concepts into clear business value, and guide stakeholders through their cloud transformation journey.
 



  





 Working closely with both our customer technical teams and business leaders, you'll help shape the strategic direction of their cloud initiatives while ensuring technical excellence in delivery.
 



  





  





**You should have:** 




  




* 4+ years' experience in a Cloud Architect (or similar) role working with Azure
* Proven experience in planning, designing and executing complex cloud migration projects.
* Deep knowledge of architectural frameworks such as Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) and Well-Architected Framework (WAF)
* Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, ARM or Bicep)
* Experience of working with modern software delivery tools and frameworks (CI/CD, DevOps, Agile/Scrum, Git)
* Experience in translating business requirements into technical solutions.
* Solution-oriented mindset with the ability to think creatively and deliver innovative solutions that create business value.
* Fluent communication skills in Swedish and English (verbal and written)



  





 It is a big advantage if you also have experience with Kubernetes, but it is not essential for the role.
 



  





**Our team culture** 




  





 If you get excited working with new technologies and keeping your knowledge up to date, you are like us. We work in agile teams in a no blame culture, where we encourage each other to be innovative and allow our team members to have the autonomy to make decisions. For us it is important to constantly improve and work proactively, and we love automating tasks as opposed to repeating them.
 



  





**Eager to learn an** 
 d develop? We make sure our teams always stay ahead by giving them time to take certificates, view or participate in webinars, lab alone or to simply take time to bounce ideas with your colleagues.
 



  





  





**What we offer you:** 




  




* Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative office in Stockholm
* We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
* An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
* A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
* Read more about the benefits we offer
 **here.**



  





  





**About Orange Business:** 




  





 Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 10 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, an
 



 d drive growth.With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.
 



  





**The process:** 




  





 We screen applications on an ongoing basis, with the aim of conducting conversations and interviews as we receive them.
 



  





 Interested but feel that you don´t match the criteria 100%? We encourage you to apply anyway! We believe in the potential of diverse skill sets, perspectives and individuality. We want to encourage everyone to be their authentic selves and your unique capabilities may align perfectly with our team's needs! Your perfect match might be the next job we are announcing, so why not have a head start and apply now!
 



  





 Are you interested to read more about Orange Business? Visit our Website or follow our LinkedIn account.

title: SEB Trainee Programme 2026-27: Business Analyst | SEB, Stockholm
description:
**Do you want to challenge, change, and steer our company into the future? Are you ready to make your mark on the finance industry and positively shape the world? Then you will thrive at SEB.**
 At SEB, we believe in fresh thinking, new working methods, and innovation to create a fairer and more sustainable world. Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success, while sustainability and digitalization influence our long-term strategy.
   

  

 With the International Trainee Programme and as an employee, we'll help you develop new skills and take on more responsibility to create a positive impact.
 **You will become a crucial key player in shaping the future of the bank** 
 .
   

  

 Your Trainee position and your team
   

  

**Ready to rethink how we do things and build new solutions?** 
 Join our Intelligent Automation team in Business Services.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
* Support work to design and implement a new operating model for automation across a large organisation
* Analyse current strategy and suggest improvements
* Create, communicate and implement new standards, best practices and ways of working
* Manage several projects to streamline the delivery of solutions such as AI, advanced automation or BI.
* Coordinate work with development resources across the organisation


 Simultaneously by working in the role you are being recruited to,
 **you will participate in SEB's International Trainee Programme for nine months** 
 . It will give you the opportunity to develop an extensive network within the bank, gain a deep understanding of the financial industry and be professionally and personally challenged.
   

  

 As part of the programme, you can expect to: contribute to meaningful projects, work on communication and leadership skills, do rotations in other teams across the bank, participate in a business challenge and do an international internship at another SEB site in the world.
   

  

 Key traits to thrive in this role and programme
   

  

 We’re looking for young talents who are curious, motivated, and ready to question the status quo.
   

  

**To thrive in this role and in the International Trainee programme, we believe you have:**
* Graduated within the past two years, or will graduate before the programme starts on 1st September 2026 – from a relevant academic degree
* Critical thinking and strong analytical skills
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to take ownership
* Great communication skills and to be able to work in English
* Proficient skills in Python or similar coding language
* An interest in Cloud and other advanced technology


**It Is Meritorious If You Have Previous Experience With**
* Data visualisation
* Working strategically in a global organisation
* Understanding of Agile or other development practices and principles


 Previous experience (part-time work, life abroad etc.) and involvement during your studies are advantageous but
 **what matters most is your potential and passion** 
 .
   

  

 In our recruitment, SEB behaviours are something we consider when choosing whom to hire. These behaviours include creating value, acting long-term, and building positive relationships.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A nine-month trainee programme, designed for professional and personal development
* A full-time employment in the role you have been hired for, after completing the programme successfully
* A real business challenge to solve with other participants in the International Trainee and Tech Trainee programmes, where you can create value and make a difference for SEB
* International exposure with opportunities to work at SEB offices in other countries
* A caring, supportive and respectful culture
* Chances to make an impact on social or environmental issues
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mentorship from senior leaders


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 The application period for the International Trainee programme is open until 11th January 2026 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact career@seb.se, but we will not process applications via e-mail.
   

  

 The International Trainee programme will start on 1st September 2026.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We want to get to know you, and for you to get to know us.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Includes**
* Psychometric tests
* Interviews – digitally and/or on-site
* A case exercise and presentation
* SEB Day – an event to learn more about SEB and the programme, with insights from former trainees


 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Find out more about the International Trainee Programme here: International Trainee Programme | SEB
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Cloud Consultant AWS
description:
**Utveckla din karriär inom Public Cloud hos Orange Business!** 




  





 Är du passionerad kring cloud-transformation och redo att driva innovation för Orange Business kunder? Vi befinner oss i en spännande tillväxtfas, med höga ambitioner för vårt Public Cloud Delivery-team, och vi söker en AWS-konsult som vill växa tillsammans med oss.
 



 I den här rollen får du en central del i att forma våra AWS-erbjudanden, leverera innovativa molnlösningar och bidra till utvecklingen av vårt team, våra kompetenser och vår kultur. Det här är din chans att bli en del av en samarbetsinriktad miljö där dina idéer räknas och där du kan göra verklig skillnad för våra kunder, vårt team och framtiden för public cloud på Orange Business.
 



  





  





**Din roll kan innebära:** 




  





 ✅ Designa och implementera skalbara molnlösningar på AWS
 



 ✅ Leda migrationsprojekt och moderniseringsinitiativ
 



 ✅ Bygga styrningsramverk och landing zones enligt AWS best practices
 



 ✅ Delta i pre-sales och kundworkshops
 



 ✅ Översätta affärskrav till säkra och skalbara AWS-arkitekturer
 



  





  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 




  




* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arkitektur och implementation i Azure
* Erfarenhet av moderna leveransverktyg och ramverk (CI/CD, DevOps, Agile/Scrum, Git)
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation, AWS CDK)
* Erfarenhet av containerisering med Docker och Amazon EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service)
* Erfarenhet av AWS serverless och integrationslösningar såsom AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, Step Functions, Amazon SQS/SNS
* God förståelse för AWS Well-Architected Framework
* Flytande kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska (tal och skrift)



  





  





**För en senior roll tror vi även att du har:** 




  




* Erfarenhet av komplexa migrationsprojekt
* Erfarenhet av att översätta affärskrav till tekniska lösningar
* Kundnära erfarenhet
* Lösningsorienterat mindset med förmåga att tänka kreativt och leverera innovativa lösningar som skapar affärsvärde



  





  





**Vår teamkultur** 




  





 Om du tycker om att arbeta med ny teknik och hålla din kunskap uppdaterad kommer du passa bra hos oss. Vi arbetar i agila team med en no-blame-kultur där vi uppmuntrar innovation och ger våra medarbetare autonomi att fatta beslut. För oss är det viktigt att ständigt förbättras, arbeta proaktivt och automatisera snarare än att repetera uppgifter.
 



 Är du nyfiken på att utvecklas? Vi ser till att våra team alltid ligger steget före genom att ge tid för certifieringar, delta i eller titta på webbinarier, labba självständigt eller helt enkelt diskutera idéer med kollegor.
 



  





  





  





**Varför ska du välja oss?** 




  




* Flexibelt arbetssätt – hybridlösning med modernt och samarbetsinriktat kontor i Stockholm
* Kontinuerliga lärandemöjligheter och certifieringar
* Vi är en människoorienterad organisation och stolta över vår Great Place to Work-certifiering
* En kultur utan skuldbeläggning – du får frihet att innovera
* Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste molnteknologin
* Ett community av experter – som Digital Natives sätter vi innovation i centrum för vår kompetens
* Läs mer om våra förmåner
 
 här.



  





  





**Om Orange Business:** 




  





 Orange Business är ett ledande nätverks- och digitalintegratörsföretag med kontor i 65 länder världen över och en del av Orange-koncernen.
 



  





 Digital Services, en affärsenhet inom Orange Business, är en nybildad division inom Orange Business. I Europa består affärsområdet av cirka 1500 medarbetare fördelade över 10 länder. Vi är digitala natives med innovation i centrum för vår verksamhet, vilket gör oss till en pålitlig partner nära våra kunder. Vårt gemensamma uppdrag är att hjälpa dem att förnya, driva och leda sin digitala transformation och sina affärsstrategier inom viktiga digitala områden, inklusive Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace samt Data & AI. Som en agil och snabbfotad digital affärspartner erbjuder affärsenheten pålitliga end-to-end-lösningar och produkter som hjälper företag i en rad olika branscher, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, att transformera sin verksamhet, förbättra kundupplevelsen och driva tillväxt.
 



  





 Med vår digitala expertis är vi en strategisk partner till Orange Business mål att vara en ledande nätverks- och digitalintegratör, med vårt team som en viktig tillväxtmotor.
 



  





  





**Rekryteringsprocessen:** 




  





 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och strävar efter att hålla intervjuer och samtal allt eftersom vi får in dem.
 



  





 Är du intresserad men känner att du inte uppfyller alla kriterier till 100 %? Vi uppmuntrar dig att söka ändå! Vi tror på styrkan i mångsidiga kompetenser, perspektiv och individers unika kvaliteter. Vi vill att alla ska känna sig fria att vara sig själva – dina unika förmågor kan passa perfekt för vårt team! Din perfekta match kanske är nästa tjänst vi annonserar, så varför inte ligga steget före och söka redan nu?
 



  





 Är du intresserad av att läsa mer om Orange Business? Besök vår
 
 hemsida
 
 eller följ oss på
 
 LinkedIn.

title: Azure Cloud Architect
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for Cloud Data Architect for our Cloud Infrastructure team.
   

  

**What You Bring**
* Design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and highly available Azure cloud infrastructures.
* Design end-to-end Azure-based data architectures including ingestion, storage, processing, and consumption layers.
* Build and maintain virtual networks, subnets, firewalls, route tables, VPN gateways, and ExpressRoute.
* Develop and manage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, following GitOps principles.
* Collaborate with application and security teams to ensure optimal network configurations and cloud architecture.
* Monitor and troubleshoot Azure resources, ensuring high availability and performance.
* Implement best practices for cloud governance, cost optimization, security, and compliance.


**Nice to have**
* Create and manage CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps for infrastructure provisioning and application deployment
* Secure handling of credentials and secrets using GitHub Secrets and environment variables.
* Implementing Git flos, trunk-based development, or feature branching for collaborative development
* Managing code versions for data pipelines, infrastructure templates, and notebooks.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**AI Engineer - Stockholm** 




  





 My client is looking for a Senior AI Engineer to join their Data & AI team to help make operations smarter, faster, and more scalable.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Build AI-driven tools and automations that optimise workflows and internal processes.
* Develop reliable systems that streamline tasks, improve data handling, and empower teams.
* Apply LLMs and other AI approaches where they make sense and know when simpler solutions are better.
* Collaborate across Sales, Finance, Engineering, and Data to turn challenges into real solutions.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* 5+ years in data or software engineering, delivering production-grade systems.
* Proficient in Python and Typescript, comfortable across front-end and back-end.
* Experienced with cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, and modern engineering practices.
* Curious, adaptable, and passionate about AI and solving real-world problems.



  





**Why Join:** 



* Make a visible impact with high-impact AI projects.
* Experiment, innovate, and shape internal operations.
* Work with a collaborative, curious, and passionate team.



  





 If you love building AI that actually works and drives results, this is the role for you.

title: Full Stack Developer – DevOps & Cloud
description:
🚀
 **Join Our Team at VIPAS AB as a Full Stack Developer – DevOps & Cloud** 
 🚀
   

  

 Do you want to be part of an innovative journey where cutting-edge technology meets automation and mobility? At VIPAS AB, we believe in building smarter, future-ready systems that drive the next wave of digital transformation. We are now looking for an experienced Fullstack Developer with a focus on Backend and DevOps to support development within Autonomous Transport Solutions (ATS).
   

  

**About VIPAS AB**
 At VIPAS AB, we go beyond traditional consulting. We deliver tailored solutions that create real impact across domains such as software development, cloud engineering, embedded systems, AI, automation, and project management. Our teams combine deep technical expertise with an innovative mindset—helping clients across industries like automotive, telecom, and manufacturing to reach new heights.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for an experienced Full Stack Developer with a focus on backend and DevOps to help develop a web-based test tool for Autonomous Transport Solutions (ATS). You will work in a small, independent team and be involved in the entire development process – from integration with the Open Autonomy interface to deployment in the AWS environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Develop and integrate backend solutions (REST, WebSocket) with AWS Cloud and other systems.
* Take responsibility for deployment, CI/CD, and operations in AWS.
* Participate in requirements work, sprint planning, and dialogue with the test team and stakeholders.
* Contribute to test automation and documentation.


**Required Skills:**
* Several years of experience in backend development (preferably in cloud environments, e.g., AWS).
* Strong skills in API development (REST, WebSocket).
* Strong skills in Java, .Net and Python.
* Experience with DevOps, CI/CD, and cloud operations (GitLab, AWS).
* Experience with test automation and quality assurance.
* Meritorious: experience from the automotive or autonomous systems sector.
* Independent, communicative, and used to working in agile teams.


**Why Join VIPAS AB?**
 At VIPAS AB, we don’t just offer projects—we offer long-term growth. As part of the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement, you’ll enjoy a secure, transparent, and balanced work environment. We work across industries such as Automotive, Telecom, and Manufacturing, offering exposure to a wide range of technologies and challenges.
   

  

 Our culture values collaboration, curiosity, and innovation. Whether you’re a seasoned expert or a driven professional ready for your next challenge, you’ll find an environment where your skills can truly make an impact.
   

  

 📩
 **Interested?**
 Apply today or reach out to shrini@vipas.se for more details.
   

  

 Applicants must hold a valid work permit. Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis.

title: EV Charging Technical Support (Mandarin/Chinese Speaker)
description:
**Driven by Intelligence. Powered for the Future.** 




  





 Autel is a global tech innovator in automotive diagnostics and smart mobility. With 2,000+ talents across 70+ countries, we fuse AI, big data, and cloud to drive the next generation of intelligent vehicles.
 



  





 As Autel Energy expands rapidly in Europe’s EV charging market, we are seeking a proactive and structured Technical Support Engineer to support our growing operations in Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden.
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 Autel France is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Technical Support Engineer to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth delivery of EV chargers and customized energy products to key clients across Europe.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Provide remote and on-site technical support for BESS installations, diagnose and resolve technical issues related to Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS).
* Responsible for the industrial development and system design of BESS.
* Define and coordinate the architecture of the BESS system, including the design of solutions for PCS (Power Conversion System), BMS (Battery Management System), EMS (Energy Management System), BAT (Battery Technology), and electrical and structural components.
* Record support cases, root cause analyses, and solutions in the company’s CRM system, conduct system performance reviews, and recommend optimization strategies.
* Promptly address technical issues reported by customers, track technical problems and perform root cause analysis and corrective actions; gather customer requirements and communicate effectively with the headquarters' R&D department.
* Create and provide technical documentation and training materials; compile maintenance case studies.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Renewable Energy, Power, Telecommunications, Electronics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Over 3 years of work experience in energy storage, renewable energy, solar PV, or power systems.
* Hands-on experience with lithium-ion batteries, inverters, or grid-tied systems.
* Willingness to travel frequently for on-site customer visits.
* Strong organizational skills, execution ability, good stress management, and team-oriented.
* Strong learning ability, service orientation, sense of responsibility, meticulous and rigorous work attitude. Strong self-motivation.
* Fluency in English; proficiency in other European languages is a plus.



  





**Why Join Autel** 



* Key operational role in shaping EV charging infrastructure in the DACH market
* Flat hierarchy with direct access to decision-makers
* Competitive salary with performance-based bonus
* International environment with high autonomy
* Dynamic, growth-oriented company with global reach



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
 



**Start date:** 
 As soon as possible
 



**Working hours:** 
 Full-time
 



  





 📩 Apply now and help us deliver cutting-edge EV charging solutions!
 



  





**Contact:** 
 Apply directly on LinkedIn or send your resume to
 **recruitment1.eu@autel.com** 




  





 👉 Please mention
 *Technical Support Engineer - BESS / EV Charger (m/w/d) – SE* 
 in the email subject.

title: Information Security Specialist
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

**The role**
 At Legora, keeping our clients’ data safe isn’t just important, it’s our core business. We’re building a security program designed for the AI era: Zero Trust at its core, compliance as a baseline, and the protection of our customers data and our AI workflows as a top priority.
   

  

 We are now expanding the security team with an Information Security Specialist to help shape, drive, and scale our security governance. You will work at the intersection of policy, compliance, and cutting edge technology to ensure we stay ahead of evolving threats while enabling our business to move fast. Incredibly fast. This is a hands-on, high-impact role where you'll set standards, manage risk and be a trusted point of contact bot for internal teams and international clients.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Work closely with our Security Lead, CTO, and engineering teams to embed Zero Trust principles and secure-by-default practices across the organization.
* Develop, implement, and maintain information security policies, standards, and procedures that are lightweight, actionable, and aligned with frameworks like ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type II, ISO 42001, and GDPR.
* Lead risk assessments, vendor security reviews, and compliance initiatives — ensuring continuous audit readiness through automation where possible.
* Support the secure AI governance efforts, defining policies that protect data and prevent adversarial use.
* Coordinate and support regular security audits, third-party penetration tests, and internal compliance checks.
* Be a primary point of contact for client security engagements, due diligence requests, and contractual security commitments.
* Drive organization-wide security awareness — running training, phishing simulations, and engaging sessions to build a security-first culture.
* Collaborate with Security Engineering and SecOps on incident response planning and execution, ensuring post-incident learnings feed back into policy and process.


**Who You Are**
* You have 3+ years in information security, GRC, or a related role in a high-growth tech environment.
* You have deep knowledge of information security principles, risk management, and data protection frameworks.
* You’ve worked with compliance standards such as GDPR, ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type II, and ideally ISO 42001 (AI management).
* You understand Zero Trust principles and how to apply them across identity, devices, and cloud services.
* You can confidently engage with engineering teams on topics like cloud security (Azure), IaC, and secure AI system design.
* You have strong analytical skills for assessing risk and prioritizing controls, and excellent communication skills to influence security culture across teams.
* Experience in securing AI/ML workflows or a strong interest in GenAI risk is a big plus


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: IT Service Manager - Point of Sale (POS) to Scandic HQ
description:
***IT Service Manager - Point of Sale (POS) to Scandic HQ***




  





 Applications are considered on a rolling basis
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



  





 Scandic is the leading hotel company in the Nordic countries, committed to creating great experiences for the many people. With bold ambitions and a strong financial foundation, we are investing in technology, innovation, and people.
 



  





 We want an IT Service Manager to join our team and take ownership of our Point of Sale (POS) systems – a key area for delivering seamless guest experiences and operational excellence across our hotels.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll be at the center of innovation, operations, and guest experience. You’ll have the overall technical responsibility for platforms like Oracle MICROS Simphony Cloud POS, and collaborate closely with vendors, internal stakeholders, and tech teams to drive change, develop new features, and shape the future of hotel tech.
 



  





 We offer an exciting role with a lot of flexibility and varied work in a fast-paced, collaborative, and friendly environment.
 



  





**What you'll do:** 



* Take ownership of POS and FnB systems (e.g. Oracle MICROS Simphony Cloud POS), ensuring they meet business needs and support future growth
* Act as the main point of contact for technical functionality, roadmap planning, and vendor collaboration
* Ensure stable and efficient service operations, including incident management, SLA follow-up, and proactive problem resolution
* Support Service Desk with documentation, escalation handling, and internal knowledge sharing
* Facilitate forums for technical development and collaborate with business stakeholders to align system capabilities with operational needs
* Ensure compliance with GDPR, security policies, and internal standards across assigned services
* Execute configuration changes and contribute to change & release processes
* Participate in budgeting, forecasting, and financial follow-up related to systems and services
* Act as a resource in service-related projects and collaborate closely with other IT Service Managers, Service Specialists, and internal tech teams



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




**What you’ll bring:** 



* Previous experience in IT service management or similar roles, preferably within hospitality, retail, or other service-oriented industries
* Solid knowledge of POS and/or FnB systems – experience with Oracle MICROS Simphony or similar platforms is a strong advantage
* Experience working with ITIL processes, especially incident, problem, and request management
* Ability to translate business needs into user-friendly, scalable technical solutions
* Strong communication skills – able to explain technical concepts in a clear, non-technical way
* Experience in providing service and solutions to larger organizations with multiple stakeholders
* Proven experience in vendor management, contract follow-up, and service delivery optimization
* A university degree in IT, system development, or a related field
* Fluency in English; Swedish or another Nordic language is a big plus



  





**About Scandic:** 




 Scandic Hotels is highly committed and proactive when it comes to Diversity & Inclusion initiatives. We are also a responsible corporate citizen and actively engaged in sustainability efforts. With around 20,000 team members, over 10 million guests and 4 million meetings a year – we have great power to drive transformation and inspire change at scale, for a better and more sustainable tomorrow.
 



  





 Our HQ is situated in newly renovated spaces right by Hagaparken on Sveavägen 167 in Stockholm. We love to be in the office but are a flexible workplace and offer a hybrid setup that suits our team members. Join in on our warm and inclusive culture and take part in all our different social activities.
 



  





**Other:** 




 Applications are welcome in Swedish or English.
 



  





 Please note: We are unable to offer relocation assistance and will prioritize applicants already based in Stockholm.
 



  





 We only accept applications through our website. All applications will be processed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible.
 



  





 We’re excited to hear from you soon!
 



  





**About the company** 




 We know that we reach further when we assent to our differences. At Scandic we want you to be yourself and develop in the direction you want to go, with the foundation of safe conditions and fair agreements. Bring your experiences, engagement and your way of thinking – contribute to a culture where we genuinely care about each other, our guests and our planet. Welcome to Scandic.
 



  





 Do you share our values?
 



  





**BE A PRO** 
**BE YOU** 
**BE CARING** 
**BE BOLD** 




  





**Contact Person** 




 Michaela Liljedahl
 



 Michaela.Liljedahl@scandichotels.com

title: Application Security Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 We are seeking an Application Security Engineer to champion security across our entire development lifecycle. You’ll play a pivotal role in reviewing code, designing secure features, and mentoring engineers, ensuring security is at the heart of everything we build. If you’re passionate about application security, thrive on close collaboration with developers, and want to do the work of your life, this is your opportunity
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable enables anyone to build software using plain English. From solo founders to Fortune 100 teams, millions use Lovable to turn ideas into products—quickly and securely. We’re leading a fundamental shift in how software is created, and you’ll help shape the security standards for this new era. With over 2 million users in 200+ countries, our reach is global—and growing fast.
   

  

 We’re a small, high-impact team based in Stockholm, driven by ownership, speed, and low-ego collaboration. We value people who care deeply, move quickly, and want to make a real difference.
   

  

**What You’ll Bring**
* 5+ years of experience in application security, securing cloud-native environments at product-focused tech companies, high-growth startups, or leading AI labs.
* Strong programming and engineering skills.
* Deep expertise in application security: secure code review, threat modeling, SAST/DAST, supply chain security, product patching, and vulnerability management.
* Strong background in securing engineering infrastructure: CI/CD pipelines, secrets management, service-to-service authentication, containerized workloads, and public cloud platforms.
* Hands-on experience collaborating with developers to design and implement security features and best practices.
* Passion for educating and mentoring engineers on secure coding, vulnerability remediation, and emerging threats.
* Systems mindset: comfortable reading and contributing to codebases, building security tooling, and integrating security into engineering workflows.
* Bonus: Experience building internal security tools or contributing to open-source security projects.


**What You’ll Do**
* Conduct secure code reviews, threat modeling, and architecture assessments to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities early.
* Work closely with engineering teams to design and implement security features, provide actionable feedback, and ensure security is embedded in product development.
* Lead security training, workshops, and 1:1 mentoring to upskill developers and foster a security-first culture.
* Integrate SAST/DAST and supply chain security tools into our CI/CD pipelines for continuous, automated protection.
* Detect, triage, and respond to application vulnerabilities and incidents, driving remediation and continuous improvement.
* Monitor and address emerging risks in AI infrastructure, LLM pipelines, and third-party dependencies.
* Secure the last piece of software.


**Our Tech Stack**
* Frontend: React and Typescript
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Google Cloud, AWS, Modal, Terraform
* DevOps & Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, observability, infrastructure-as-code


 And always exploring what’s next.
   

  

**How To Apply**
* Please submit your application in English—our working language at Lovable.
* We’re committed to fair and equal treatment for all candidates. If you’re interested, apply via our careers portal

title: Lead FinOps Engineer
description:
At Sandvik Group IT, we’re now looking for a Lead FinOps Engineer to join our Cloud area. We welcome you to an exciting role with the opportunity to create your own success!
   

  

 We provide Sandvik with IT infrastructure, systems and business critical solutions, and are on a journey to reach higher levels of business agility and to strengthen the empowerment of our development and operation teams. Our vision is to stay a trusted and driving partner in Sandvik’s accelerating and ambitious digitalization journey.
   

  

**About Your Job**
 In this role, you maintain the technical backbone of Sandvik’s cloud FinOps engagement. You lead the strategy for cloud consumption, ensuring that cost data is reliable, actionable, and delivered through scalable automation. By collaborating across teams, you enable them to make smarter cloud decisions – without compromising speed or agility – and foster a culture of financial accountability. You build smart tooling and processes that turn raw billing data into visibility, actionable insights, and saving opportunities.
   

  

 Included in your responsibility:
   

  

* Design and maintain cost data pipelines from billing services and native clouds.
* Build a pipeline of FinOps recommendations.
* Develop dashboards and datasets for Finance, Product, and Engineering teams.
* Implement anomaly detection, budget alerts, and policy-as-code guardrails.
* Automate tagging compliance, resource hygiene and rightsizing tasks.
* Collaborate with Finance to define and implement chargeback/showback models.
* Manage Reserved Instances, Saving Plans and forecasting utilization.
* Ensure data quality and integrate FinOps tools with ticketing and CI/CD.
* Drive KPI definitions and adoption across the organization.


 The location for this position is preferably Stockholm or Sandviken, while other locations may be considered for the right candidate. We offer you a hybrid work solution.
   

  

**About You**
 You have a background in computer science, data engineering, information systems, or a related technical field—possibly combined with experience in finance or cloud operations. You’re skilled in working with large datasets, building pipelines, and developing dashboards that turn complex cloud billing data into actionable insights. You bring hands-on experience with Azure (AWS is a plus), and you understand the cost dynamics of cloud services. Experience with FinOps practices or certifications (Practitioner or Professional) is an advantage. Fluency in English is essential, and Swedish is a plus.
   

  

 You take ownership and lead with initiative—always looking for ways to improve systems and processes. You’re curious, adaptable, and thrive in a fast-changing tech environment. With strong communication skills, you make complex data understandable to both technical and non-technical audiences. You enjoy solving problems, sharing knowledge, and building strong cross-functional relationships.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Kim Tuuliainen, hiring manager,
   

  

 kim.tuuliainen@sandvik.com
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* Malena Rackner, Unionen, +46 (0)70 242 33 90
* Tord Engström, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)76 106 62 87
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Lisbeth Häggström
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than November 17, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0085070.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers’ processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2024, the group had approximately 41,000 employees, sales in more than 150 countries and revenues of about SEK 123 billion.*

title: Technical Program Manager - AI Evals & Strategy
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

**The role**
 As a
 **Technical Program Manager for AI Evaluations** 
 , you’ll drive the strategy and execution of our evaluation efforts from inception to release. You will own the evals roadmap end-to-end in partnership with product and engineering to enable faster and better product delivery. You’ll also coordinate across internal stakeholders and external vendors to plan, track, and deliver initiatives, while implementing monitoring systems and analyzing outcomes to translate insights into actionable feedback.
   

  

 As our platform scales rapidly, you’ll play a central role in building a world-class evaluation function that ensures the performance, reliability, and integrity of our product matches our ambition.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Manage evaluation projects end-to-end: own timelines, deliverables and internal and external resources across the full range of evaluation needs and initiatives.
* Define evaluation objectives, methods, and success criteria in partnership with product, engineering and legal engineering teams.
* Interface with cross-functional teams to ensure evaluation strategies are not only aligned with product goals and technical capabilities but also actively facilitate the creation of evaluations to enable faster and better product delivery.
* Coordinate external contributors, from legal experts and research partners to client companies, and integrate their input into evaluations that drive capabilities. You’ll define scopes, onboard contributors, and ensure high-quality outputs that meet technical and product standards.
* Evaluate and translate results of evaluation into real improvements for the product and engineering.


**Who You Are**
* Strong academic background in Engineering or related field, with a degree from a top-tier university.
* 2+ years of experience as a Technical Program Manager, management consultant, or a similar project-driven role in fast growing organizations.
* Proven track record of successfully delivering complex projects, including stakeholder management and cross-functional coordination.
* Excellent communicator who can simplify and align technical and business goals.
* Interest in and understanding of AI models, evaluation methods, and AI product development.
* Energized by building from scratch — hands-on, pragmatic, and motivated by getting things over the line. You don’t get hung up on details, but push through to get things done.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Sales Manager Cloud & Software
description:
****Why choose TD SYNNEX:****
 As a
 **Fortune 500 global company** 
 operating in over 100 countries, TD SYNNEX values its diverse workforce of 24,000 employees. As the world’s largest IT distributor, our mission is to deliver top-class technology solutions that enable businesses and individuals to navigate the digital world in a safe and efficient way. In addition,
 **TD SYNNEX Nordics is a certified “Great Place To Work” in all 4 Nordic countries.**
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Sales Manager to lead our Cloud & Software team in Solna. The team consists of 5 talented sales professionals covering AWS, Google Cloud, Data & AI solutions. This role is about coaching people, setting direction, and inspiring the team to reach the next level.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Lead, coach, and develop a team of 5 sales professionals.
* Drive growth across AWS, Google, and Data & AI solution areas.
* Set clear goals, track performance, and remove roadblocks.
* Act as a partner to vendors and internal stakeholders to strengthen go-to-market.
* Support account strategy, customer meetings, and QBRs when needed.
* Foster a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous learning.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Proven track record in sales leadership, ideally in cloud or software.
* Strong coaching skills – you are a leader, not just a manager.
* Commercial understanding of AWS, Google Cloud, and Data & AI offerings.
* Ability to work strategically while staying close to the team’s day-to-day reality.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English.


****What We Offer:****
**Hybrid work (2- 3 days per week at the office)**
 We value continuous learning and provide a clear progression plan.
   

  

 We provide
 **comprehensive benefits** 
 including
 **health insurance** 
 , retirement plans, and more
   

  

**Key Skills**
 At TD SYNNEX, our values guide everything we do: Together, We Own It, We Dare to Go, We Grow and Win, and above all, We Do the Right Thing. These principles shape how we work with each other, our partners, and our communities as we drive innovation and create lasting impact.
   

  

**What’s In It For You?**
* Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
* Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
* Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
* Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It’s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
* Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
* Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


**Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.**
 At TD SYNNEX, we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you’re excited about working for our company and believe you’re a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!

title: Business Controller
description:
**Din nya roll** 




 Vi söker nu en erfaren Business Controller med fokus på Operational Excellence till ett uppdrag inom en global R&D-organisation i Södertälje. I rollen blir du en del av ledningsgruppen och ansvarar för att stötta verksamheten i samtliga finansiella processer, såsom planering, budgetering, prognosarbete och månadsuppföljningar. Du bidrar aktivt till att driva kontinuerliga förbättringar, säkerställa finansiell kvalitet och ge värdefulla insikter som stöd för strategiska beslut. Tjänsten innebär även att du tar fram rapporter och presentationer till ledning och andra intressenter samt samarbetar tätt med globala och tvärfunktionella team.
 



  





**För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll behöver du** 




 - Ha flera års erfarenhet, gärna åtta till tio eller fler, inom finansiell controlling.
 



 - Du har en stark analytisk förmåga och kan omvandla data till tydliga och användbara beslutsunderlag.
 



 - Du har mycket goda kunskaper i MS Excel, PowerPoint och Power BI samt god förståelse för verktyg som EPM Cloud och SAP.
 



 - Du har en masterexamen inom ekonomi, företagsekonomi eller industriell ekonomi.
 



 - Rollen kräver att du behärskar både svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Du är en strukturerad och självgående person som trivs i en internationell och dynamisk miljö. Du har förmåga att leda och inspirera andra, kommunicerar tydligt och fattar beslut med trygghet. Du är analytisk men också kreativ och tänker gärna nytt för att hitta effektiva lösningar och förbättrade arbetssätt.
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan** 




 Anställningens omfattning: 100%
 



 Anställningsform: Tidsbegränsad anställning som konsult via JobBusters
 



 Arbetsmodell: På plats i Södertälje
 



 Lön: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 Start: Omgående
 



 Slut: 2026-06-30, med möjlighet till förlängning
 



 Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-07
 



 Utvalda förmåner: Kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag, Benifex med mera
 



 Övrig information: Bakgrundskontroll kan förekomma
 



  





**Bra att känna till!** 




 Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande. Då processerna i konsultvärlden ofta går snabbt kan tjänsten tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum – vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan!
 



  





 Du behöver inte skriva ett personligt brev utan i stället ber vi dig svara på urvalsfrågorna i samband med ansökan.

title: Fullstack Engineer - Commercial Tech
description:
As a Fullstack Engineer at Embark, you will be a Gamemaker in a technical team that builds and maintains internal tools that empower our game teams and improve the studio’s efficiency. Your role will directly support game development by creating solutions that automates and streamlines workflows, and provides valuable analytics. You will also be contributing to commercial projects like tools for monetization and customer support.
   

  

 The team’s goal is to deliver scalable, user-friendly, and cost-efficient solutions that help our teams create dynamic and engaging player experiences. You’ll collaborate closely with game teams, data teams, and the commercial team, reporting to the Tech Lead in Commercial Tech.
   

  

 As an integral part of a creative and autonomous team, you’ll contribute to high-quality tools and systems for both developers and players. For the frontend we use technologies like React, TypeScript and NextJS. For the backend we use Go, protobuf, Python, and OpenAPI.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Develop and improve internal tools for game teams and studio-wide use.
* Automate workflows to reduce manual effort and enhance efficiency.
* Build personalized store recommendation systems and tools.
* Continuously refine engineering practices to ensure services are easy to deploy, scale, and maintain.
* Collaborate with multiple teams to deliver tools and solutions that improve both developer and player experiences.


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* Solid experience with React, TypeScript, NextJS, Go, Python and the GCP stack.
* Proven ability to build internal data-driven tools and services.
* Experience deploying and maintaining services on cloud infrastructure.
* Strong background in analytics and data-driven tooling.
* Analytical mindset, self-driven and capable of taking projects from idea to implementation.
* Experience in the gaming industry or other consumer-facing products.
* Passion for games, interactive experiences and new technologies.
* Professional English communication skills.


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Business Controller
description:

 We believe you are an analytical and structured person and have the ability to work independently in driving the progress and reaching expected results within your areas of responsibility. You are a team player with good leadership skills and can make fast and clear decisions, motivate others and lead by example. You are creative and think outside the box in order to find solutions. Since the role entails recurring presentations we believe you are a good communicator with the ability to convey a message.
 



  





 You are part of a global management team for an R&D Area and support the organisation in all financial processes such as financial planning, budget, and monthly follow up.

* Good expertise in MS Office applications Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI is essential for this role

**Education:**

**This role requires fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.** 




 This is a full-time consultant position in Södertälje through Incluso. Start is ASAP, 7 months limited contract to begin with. This position is 100% onsite in Södertälje.
 



  





 Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.
 



  





 For more information about this role, please contact Emma Hörnsten, recruiter at Incluso.
